description: Due to preservation work underway, the Great Hall is currently closed to visitation. Please check later for updates.

title: Bush Key is Closed
description: The Bush Key seasonal closure is in effect through September to support the largest breeding colony of sooty and brown noddy terns in the continental U.S.

title: Park Store is Cash Only
description: Currently our cash and debit card reader in our park store is not working. We are only able to accept cash. We apologize for the inconvenience.

title: Camping and Docking at Boca Chita and Elliott Keys
description: Docking at Boca Chita and Elliott Keys: $25.00 Friday - Monday and Federal Holidays Camping at Boca Chita and Elliott Keys: $35.00 per night. Payments must be made on site using the recreation.gov phone app.

title: Construction Closures and Delays
description: Expect closures and delays at the summit of Kīlauea due to a two-year construction project to repair or remove damaged buildings and infrastructure.

title: Williams Ranch Road Closed
description: The Williams Ranch Road is currently impassable and closed to public access due to unsafe conditions.

title: Only Left Side of Diablo East and Rough Canyon Boat Ramps Are Open - Rest Are Closed
description: Due to low water levels, only the left side of Diablo East and Rough Canyon boat ramps are open. Please use caution with Spur 406 and Spur 454 launches, as the water may be too shallow to launch most boats. To see a list of open ramps, click on "more."

title: Temporary Trail Closure to Protect Nesting Falcons
description: From February 1st through May 31st, a portion of the East Rim Trail in the Chisos Mountains will be closed to protect nesting falcons. The closure includes East Rim backpacking campsites ER-4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9. For details and a map, click "more."

title: Selma Interpretive Center Closed for Major Construction
description: The Selma Interpretive Center and bookstore will remain closed to the public until the project’s completion, which is expected by fall 2025. The Lowndes and Montgomery Interpretive Centers are open.
Park Full Name: Selma to Montgomery National Historic Trail

title: Bathrooms at Birthplace Closed Until Further Notice
description: The Reconstructed Birthplace bathrooms on the LBJ Ranch are closed until further notice. Portable toilets are available at the Cemetery, and pit toilets are located behind the Junction School. Bathrooms with running water can be found at LBJ State Park.
Park Full Name: Lyndon B. Johnson National Historical Park

title: Fort Pickens Visitor Center (Discovery Center) Closure
description: The Fort Pickens Visitor Center, the green and white building, is closed until further notice for repairs. For contact with a ranger visit Fort Pickens.

title: Fort Barrancas Closure
description: Fort Barrancas is closed until May.

title: Seasonal Road Closure - Road to Lava Point and West Rim Trailhead closed
description: This is a regular seasonal closure, and we will remove this alert when snow melts. Lava Point Overlook is closed.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Road to Lava Point and West Rim Trailhead closed', 'id': 'C042AC3C-E893-4ED9-8FB7-A4A1713FFC48', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/zion/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: Partial Closure due to Carr Fire
description: While most of the park has reopened after the 2018 Carr Fire, some areas are still closed for safety. Please exercise caution when hiking in areas affected by the Carr Fire. Follow this link for more information - http://tinyurl.com/66jrs8vx

title: We are Open but Experiencing Phone and Internet Outage
description: We are experiencing internet and phone outages beyond our control. If you are trying to reach us, please call 925-812-6164.
Park Name: Rosie the Riveter WWII Home Front
Park Full Name: Rosie the Riveter/World War II Home Front National Historical Park

title: Little Round Top Rehabilitation Project Closure Notice
description: Little Round Top CLOSED TO ALL VISITATION on Tuesday, July 26, 2022. Little Round Top is estimated to reopen to the public in late Spring or early Summer, 2024.

title: Apostle Islands National Lakeshore Ice Caves Are Closed
description: Due to unstable ice conditions, an ongoing closure remains in effect for ice caves within the boundaries of the park. This includes ice cave areas accessed from Meyers Beach Road. The last time stable ice allowed access to the ice caves was 2015.

title: South River Picnic Grounds & Dundo Picnic Grounds and Campground Water Alert
description: Water is not available at South River and Dundo Picnic Grounds. Fires and grills are not permitted at these two locations.

title: Reds Meadow Road Access Restrictions in 2024
description: Reds Meadow Road and shuttle service, which provide access to Devils Postpile National Monument, will be closed 24 hours per day for construction work from Sundays at 11 pm through Fridays at 9 am (excluding holidays) during the summer 2024 season.

title: Restroom Closure on 5th Street
description: The restrooms at 5th & Chestnut Streets are closed for the season. Restrooms remain available at the Independence Visitor Center at 6th & Market Streets.

title: Main Street Walpack Bridge Closed Until Further Notice
description: Main Street in Walpack Center is closed at the Flatbrook Bridge due to structural damage to the bridge. The cause of the damage is under investigation.
Park Full Name: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area

title: Artifacts Removed From Museum
description: After an extensive rehab project, the visitor center reopened in September 2023. Due to unforeseen water leaks and humidity issues, all the historic artifacts have been taken off exhibit to protect them until these issues have been resolved.

title: Secure trash and food
description: Pack it in, pack it out! There are no trash services in or around the monument. All food & trash must be secured inside a vehicle or hard sided containers. Ravens routinely open zipped bags & tear into trash bags left outside or in the bed of a truck.

title: East Parking Lot Restoration
description: Restoration of the parking lot East side of Route 345 (off Hopewell Rd) is anticipated to start this week.  No parking North of Hopewell Rd and slight trail & bridge diversions will be necessary during the project, anticipated to be completed Spring 2024.

title: Ticket Required to Hike Old Rag
description: March 1 - November 30 those wishing to hike Old Rag are required to obtain a day-use ticket before arriving.

title: Big Cypress National Preserve Begins Prescribed Fire Season
description: If you are planning a trip to Big Cypress, please keep an eye on our website and/or social media for updates about the current Prescribed Fire Season

title: Santa Elena Canyon Trail
description: To access the Santa Elena Canyon Trail, hikers must first cross the bed of Terlingua Creek, and climb a short but steep bank. Conditions change constantly at this location (sand, mud, or shallow/deep water). Carefully assess before attempting to cross.

title: North Beach Restrooms are Closed
description: The restrooms at North Beach are closed until further notice for infrastructure repairs. The closest restrooms are at Drakes Beach.

title: Preservation Work on Buildings and Grounds
description: Work is underway to repair the roofs and enhance the water-shedding systems on both the Longfellow house and carriage house and to complete tree work. Temporary detours and path closures may be in place for visitor safety.
Park Full Name: Longfellow House-Washington's Headquarters National Historic Site

title: Seasonal Closures In Effect
description: Seasonal closures are in effect to protect nesting birds of prey on cliffs and rock formations in the park. Please refer to closure lists in park brochures and on the raptor advisory page for more information.

title: Charles Pinckney National Historic Site Visitor Center Closed
description: The historic house is closed for the season. Park grounds are open Wednesday - Sunday, 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM. We hope to re-open the house in Spring 2024. The passport stamp is located at Fort Moultrie on Sullivan's Island. Monitor this page for updates.

title: Winter storms and trail damage
description: With winter wind storms coming and going, tree and trail damage will be fixed as weather and staffing allows. If there is a tree down or trail damage please report it to the visitor center with exact location of the damage.
Park Full Name: Lewis and Clark National Historical Park

title: Storm Damage Significant
description: A winter storm on Wed Jan 10 led to significant damage to facilities throughout the park, such as the Ocean Path. Please be aware of debris, loose rocks, and uneven footing. Unless noted otherwise, all park areas remain open at this time.

title: Upper Cliff Dwelling Tours Full
description: Upper Cliff Dwelling tours are fully booked through the April 2024 season. Cancellations may occur, but they are rare. Reservations for next season will be taken starting October 1, 2024 for November 2024-April 2025.

title: Trail Ridge Road is Closed to Through Travel for the Winter Season
description: Trail Ridge Road, which is Hwy 34 through RMNP, is closed to through travel for the winter. The road is closed at Many Parks Curve on the east side of the park and at the Colorado River Trailhead on the west side. For more information, call 970-586-1222.

title: Paradise Sledding Area is closed for the 2024 season.
description: The sledding area will not open this year due to limited staffing. The official Paradise Sledding Area is the safest and only location that sledding is permitted in Mount Rainier National Park.

title: Lake Mead NRA has transitioned to a cashless fee collection system
description: Lake Mead NRA has transitioned to a cashless fee collection system, accepting only electronic card payments for entrance, lake use, and campground fees. Entrance stations will continue to sell passes only with credit card.

title: Martinez Adobe
description: The Martinez Adobe, located on the western edge of John Muir’s historic orchard, is currently closed due to structural damage. It is unknown when the public will be able to enter the structure. The Muir/Strentzel mansion remains open to visitors.

title: Possible Delays up to 1 hour are possible at Kelbaker Road Railroad Crossing near Kelso Depot
description: In the event there are train siding operations at the crossing near Kelso Depot, delays may be up to one hour. Please plan accordingly for this possibility with extra fuel and drinking water.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Kelso Railroad Crossing Delays 1 hour or more', 'id': 'C5F70745-7FBD-404D-9410-0428C5185440', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/moja/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: No Recreational Vehicle (RV) Parking
description: Our parking lot cannot accommodate RVs or trailers. Please call the visitor center for options as we have a nearby lot for trailers to detach and are happy to help visitors in RVs plan their way to the park. RVs should NOT pull into the parking lot.

title: Highway 50 Construction
description: Road construction and closures will continue in 2024. The project is located on US Highway 50 between mileposts 123 and 127, approx. 30 miles east of Montrose, Colorado. Refer to www.us50info.com for updated construction information.
Park Full Name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park

title: Texas White House Complex Closure
description: On January 2, 2024 the Texas White House Complex closed so the construction phase of the Texas White House rehabilitation can begin. The LBJ Ranch driving tour remains open. Visitors can still see the school, cemetery, birthplace and showbarn.
Park Full Name: Lyndon B. Johnson National Historical Park

title: Visitor Center Phones Down
description: Phones at the Lowndes and Selma Interpretive Centers are currently down. Please call the Montgomery Interpretive Center at (334)293-0597 for questions or to make a reservation for a group visit.
Park Full Name: Selma to Montgomery National Historic Trail

title: Val-Kill Cottage Tours
description: Val-Kill is closed for the season and will reopen in the Spring with a date to be determined. The grounds remain open during normal operating hours.

title: Men's Restrooms at Fort Sumter Under Repair
description: Currently, the men's restrooms at Fort Sumter are out of service. However, there are restrooms available on the ferry boat, which remains docked at the fort for the duration of your stay.
Park Full Name: Fort Sumter and Fort Moultrie National Historical Park

title: Major Construction Project at the Fall River Entrance to Rocky Mountain National Park
description: Construction work is happening near Fall River Entrance & Aspenglen Campground. One lane is open to enter and exit. Speed limit is 15-mph.

title: Winter Hours - Visitor Center
description: From October 29, through April 27, the Visitor Center is open Thursday-Monday 9:00am to 5:00pm and closed Tuesday and Wednesday.

title: Red Gate Fire Road
description: Closed to vehicular traffic.

title: Tanners Ridge Fire Road
description: Closed to vehicular traffic.

title: Maryland Route 77 Detour Information
description: Starting Jan. 8, 2024, a section of Maryland Rt. 77 will be closed for utility work through May 2024. Visitors accessing the park from Rt. 15 will be detoured to Rt. 550 to Foxville Deerfield Rd. Follow the link for a map and additional information.

title: No Ferry Service on Tuesdays
description: The ferry service to the fort is closed on Tuesdays. However, the visitor center and surrounding grounds remain open seven days a week.

title: Park Closures
description: From time to time the missile range that surrounds the park performs military testing that may require the closure of the park or Highway 70. Please plan your visit around upcoming military tests.

title: Public Restroom Status
description: Restrooms are available at the Filene Center Main Gate and in the white Barn behind Ovations Restaurant. The Meadow Comfort Station (located in the Meadow behind the Filene Center) has been winterized.
Park Name: Wolf Trap National Park for the Performing Arts
Park Full Name: Wolf Trap National Park for the Performing Arts

title: Arizona Off-Highway Vehicle (OHV) Requirements for Residents and Non-residents.
description: Off-highway vehicles (OHVs) are required by law to display a valid OHV decal to operate on public and state trust lands in Arizona. This includes “street legal” vehicles that meet these two requirements.

title: Looking for a Grand Canyon view? A warning about GPS navigation using mobile devices.
description: GPS apps on mobile devices may direct visitors to "Grand Canyon-Parashant" who type "Grand Canyon" into their driving directions. Roads across Parashant require 4-wheel drive and all-terrain tires. There are no visitor services or cell reception here.

title: Grand Canyon-Parashant National Monument is not part of Grand Canyon National Park
description: Grand Canyon National Park is only part of the 277 mile-long Grand Canyon. Parashant starts on the north rim of the Grand Canyon west of Tuweep and stretches to the Nevada state line. Click 'More' for the Grand Canyon National Park website.

title: Rainy Lake Visitor Center & Kabetogama Lake Visitor Center Re-Opening Weekends January - March
description: Rainy Lake Visitor Center will re-open 1/5/24 for the winter season January - March (3 days a week); Fri/Sat/Sun 10am - 4pm. Kabetogama Lake Visitor Center will also re-open 1/5/24 for the winter season January - March (2 days a week); Fri/Sat 10am - 4pm.

title: Trail Advisory
description: Several trails in the park are temporarily closed. Please check the "Trail and Backcountry Closures, Warnings & Cautions" section of the Current Road, Facility, Trail & Backcountry Updates page for further details.

title: Florissant Fossil Beds has moved to cashless fee collection
description: Entrance fees and pass purchases must be made with a credit/debit card or payment app on a mobile device. Electronic payment reduces transaction times, saves money, and improves accountability.

title: Lincoln Memorial elevator out of order (Dec. 29)
description: The elevator from the ground level to the chamber at the Lincoln Memorial is out of order due to electrical issues. We apologize for any inconvenience.

title: Washington Monument and Old Post Office Tower are closed for maintenance one day each month
description: Scheduled closures for 2024: Wed., January 3; Thurs., February 1; Mon., March 4; Mon., April 1; Wed., May 1; Tues., June 4; Tues., July 9; Thurs., August 1; Wed., Sept. 4; Tues, Oct. 1; Wed., November 6; Thurs., December 5. Also closed July 4 and Dec. 25.

title: Washington Monument is closed for maintenance one day each month
description: Closures for 2024: Wed., Jan. 3; Thurs., Feb. 1; Mon., March 4; Mon., Apr. 1; Wed., May 1; Tues., June 4; Tues., July 9; Thurs., Aug. 1; Wed., Sept. 4; Tues, Oct. 1; Wed., Nov. 6; Thurs., Dec. 5. The monument is also closed on July 4 and Dec. 25.

title: Park Remains Open to Visitors: Some Buildings Closed due to Long-Term Repairs
description: The History Museum, Roundhouse, Railyard, and grounds are open to visitors. The Visitor Center, Theatre, Technology Museum and Locomotive Cutaway Exhibit remain closed until long-term repairs to our heating and cooling system are made.

title: Coughing or Sneezing? The wearing of masks inside the WNPA Park Store is appreciated.
description: Due to the limited space of the Park Store, wearing a mask is considerate of others if you are coughing or sneezing. Maximum occupancy in the store is 11 individuals at any one time. Visiting groups must consider this limit and stagger entry responsibly.

title: Scenic Drive Closed
description: The Scenic Drive is closed for the winter season. The visitor center is accessible and open Mondays-Saturdays 8-4:30, excluding holidays.

title: Thomas Stone National Historic Site Closed for Winter
description: Thomas Stone National Historic Site will close for the season on Monday, 12/25/2023, and will reopen in Spring 2024.

title: Storm Damage
description: Due to storm damage and ongoing cleanup, parts of the Olmsted landscape will be temporarily closed. Please use caution and adhere to signage and closures. Information will be updated as soon as possible.
Park Full Name: Frederick Law Olmsted National Historic Site

title: New Hours Starting January 2
description: Starting January 2, 2024, the Lincoln Home Visitor Center will be open from 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM.

title: Exit Glacier Developed Area OPEN to Snowmachine use for 2023/24 season
description: Kenai Fjords National Park opened the Exit Glacier Developed Area to off road snowmachine use on Monday, December 18, 2023.

title: Closure for Renovation
description: The Visitor Center at Spalding will be closed for remodel December 3, 2023, until late spring 2024.

title: Route 7 from Sawmill, AZ is NOT recommended
description: Entering the park from the east at Sawmill, AZ on Route 7 is not recommended. Part of this route is UNPAVED and UNMAINTAINED. Please stay on paved roads, such as Indian Route 64 from Tsaile, AZ and Highway 191/Route 7 from Chinle, AZ.

title: Safety Assessments for Canyon Tours
description: During flash floods, the canyon may be closed temporarily to tours. Safety assessments of the canyon will be conducted during severe conditions. The Navajo Nation asks all individuals to take the necessary precautions when entering the canyon.

title: Trail Closures Due to Wildfire Damage
description: Elwha River, Hayden Pass, Dosewallips: Dose Meadows to Hayden Pass, North Fork Quinault: Elip Creek to Low Divide, Skyline: Elip Creek Trail junction to Low Divide, Martins Park

title: Road construction on approach to park's Homestead entrance
description: Roadwork is underway along State Road 9336 leading to the Homestead entrance of the park, approaching the Ernest F. Coe Visitor Center. Drivers may experience short delays and should watch for personnel, construction equipment, and slowdowns.

title: CENTRAL VA – PARKING LOT CLOSURE– ROUTE 311/MCAFEE KNOB
description: McAfee Knob/Route 311 parking area along the A.T. in Catawba will be closed Thursday, November 30. The lot is being closed to allow for the construction of a new pedestrian footbridge over Route 311.

title: Hawk Creek Lane Restriction at Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area
description: Due to undercutting action of Hawk Creek on the access road between the Hawk Creek campground and boat launch, the road will be reduced to one lane until further notice. Use caution while on this road.

title: Extended Fish Cleaning Station Closure
description: Park fish cleaning stations will remain closed while the NPS researches and tests better alternatives. This closure includes the restroom facility located at the Fort Spokane boat launch.

title: Livestock Plan
description: The Livestock Plan Environmental Assessment (EA) was available for public review from September 25, 2023, to November 24, 2023. Follow link for park planning website.

title: George Washington Carver Museum and The Oaks are closed
description: The George Washington Carver Museum and The Oaks are closed for repairs and rehabilitation. The Oaks is anticipated to reopen Spring/Summer 2024. We anticipate the George Carver Museum to tentatively reopen in Fall 2024.

title: Return to 419 Decatur Street
description: The New Orleans Jazz NHP & Jean Lafitte NHP&P French Quarter Visitor Center moved back to 419 Decatur Street on August 8, 2023. Open Tuesdays through Saturdays, 9:30 am to 4:30 pm. Calendar for events: https://www.nps.gov/jazz/planyourvisit/calendar.htm
Park Full Name: New Orleans Jazz National Historical Park

title: Poor Trail Conditions on the Calumet Bike Trail
description: The section of trail from the Dune Park Train Station to East State Park Road is in very poor condition with large, deep puddles of standing water and sections with larger gravel stones. Ride this section with extreme caution.

title: Visitor Center and Museum Operating Hours
description: Kings Mountain NMP Visitor Center hours are Wednesday through Sunday from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Public restrooms and park grounds are open 7 days per week 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily.

title: Uber, Lyft, and Other "Taxi" Services
description: Bandelier is in a remote location, with cell service in the canyon limited to Verizon 4G only. Services like Uber and Lyft will bring you here, but there may be no way to contact a ride out. Please plan your pickup before being dropped off at Bandelier.

title: The Use of GPS is NOT Recommended
description: Numerous visitors have been routed to remote trailheads and out-of-the-way roads trying to use GPS to reach the main park area or shuttle stop.

title: Sidewalk work in National Cemetery
description: The maintenance crew is working on rehabilitation of the sidewalk surrounding the Presidential burial plot. Be aware that some sections of the sidewalk may be closed.

title: Marsh-Billings-Rockefeller National Historical Park is Cashless
description: Tours may be purchased online (recreation.gov) or in person with a credit or debit card only. Cash transactions are not available at the park.

title: Select Trails Require Day Use Pass from Woodstock Inn & Resort Nordic Center
description: Four miles of trail along the carriage road corridors have been designated as ‘Multi-Use Trails’ in winter – walkers are permitted to use these trails free of charge. All other trails require a day/season pass from the Woodstock Inn. See link for details.

title: Picnic Area Restrooms and Park Water Fountains - Closed for Season
description: The public restrooms and water fountain at the Picnic Area have been closed for winterization. They will reopen in Spring 2024. The water fountain in the Memorial Area has been closed for winterization. It will reopen in Spring 2024.

title: West and East Border Roads closed for public safety
description: The border roads remain closed (the dirt roads directly along the border and all crossover roads leading from South Puerto Blanco Drive to the border) to all public vehicle and pedestrian traffic for public safety. South Puerto Blanco Drive remains open.

title: Gachado Line Camp open. Southeast border road and access roads closed
description: El Camino De Dos Republicas remains open from SR85 to Gachado Line Camp. Dos Lomitas is not accessible. The southeast border road from Lukeville Port of Entry eastward to the Santa Rosa Mountains is closed to public vehicle and pedestrian traffic.

title: Water Off in the Campground
description: The water in the campground is shut off for the season. The campground comfort stations are also closed. Vault toilets in the campground remain available 24 hours. Drinking water is only available in the visitor center when open.
Park Full Name: Craters of the Moon National Monument and Preserve

title: All lava tube caves closed November 1st through April 30th
description: All park lava tube caves are closed for the winter from November 1st through April 30th to protect hibernating bats. This closure does not affect the Junction Bridge Cave at the start of El Calderon Trail.

title: Limited Parking at Overlook Park - 72 McBride Avenue Extension
description: Parking is extremely limited on weekends & stadium event days. Additional parking may be available at the Paterson Museum at 2 Market Street - click "more" for info
Park Full Name: Paterson Great Falls National Historical Park

title: Weeping Rock Shuttle Bus Stop, Parking Area, and Trail Closed
description: Due to rockfall, the area near Weeping Rock is temporarily closed. Park scientists and maintenance staff are monitoring the area.

title: North Entrance and Loop Roads Closed for the Winter Season
description: As of November 3, 2023, the North Entrance Road and the Katahdin View Loop Road are closed to wheeled vehicles for the winter season. Access by foot and bicycle is permitted.
Park Full Name: Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument

title: Multiple road projects underway
description: Road status information with links to project information is updated daily.

title: Temporary Closures Due to Winter Road Maintenance
description: From late fall through the winter, park personnel conduct winter maintenance activities in multiple sections of the Parkway. These daily closures require full, 2-lane closures to all uses during the workday.

title: Closures Due to Weather
description: Temporary winter weather-related closures may be in effect along the parkway. Please check the road and facility closure page for updates to the road status.

title: CCC Camp Picnic Pavilions Closed
description: The pavilions in the CCC Camp Picnic Area are closed for the immediate future for restoration work.

title: Seasonal Closures
description: Jumonville Glen, Mount Washington Tavern and the Picnic Area have closed for the season. They will reopen on May 1, 2024!

title: Riverbend Overlook Closure
description: Due to construction, the Riverbend Overlook is currently closed.

title: Belmont-Paul Women's Equality NM exterior lift out of order
description: Renovation work funded through the Great American Outdoors Act (GAOA) is complete. The museum is open to the public on Fridays-Sundays from 10 am - 5 pm. The exterior lift is temporarily out of order. We apologize for the inconvenience.

title: Pipe Spring Remains on Mountain Standard Time Zone
description: Pipe Spring is in Arizona, which does not observe Daylight Saving Time, while neighboring communities in Utah do. This means Pipe Spring is one hour "behind" our Utah neighbors, so please take that into account while planning your visit this summer.

title: Island Public docks re-open 11/10/23
description: Repairs to the damaged portions of the Dungeness Dock and Sea Camp Dock are complete. Public docking is now available on the north end of each of the docks - inside and out. All docking guidelines apply. Entrance fees can be paid online at www.pay.gov

title: Road to Exit Glacier CLOSED to automobiles for the winter
description: The road to Exit Glacier is now closed to automobile access at mile 1.3 of the Herman Leirer Road for the summer season.

title: Second Level Access Reduced
description: Access to the second level of the fort is temporarily restricted. The park remains open, but visitor access to the fort will be limited to its ground floor spaces and rooms.
Park Full Name: Bent's Old Fort National Historic Site

title: Do Not Handle Wildlife
description: If you see a dead bat or a bat acting strangely at the fort, please do not touch or move it. Report the location of the animal to park staff.
Park Full Name: Bent's Old Fort National Historic Site

title: Part of Fort Totten Park remains closed for public safety
description: Out of an abundance of caution, Fort Totten Park will remain closed east of Fort Totten Drive, south of Gallatin Street/Metropolitan Branch Trail and north of Brookland Ave NE/Farragut St. due to the investigation involving two WWI-era munitions found.

title: Winter 2023-2024
description: Perry's Victory and International Peace Memorial has closed for the winter. Grounds remain open. We look forward to seeing you Saturday May 18, 2024 when the Visitor Center & Memorial will open for the 2024 season.
Park Full Name: Perry's Victory and International Peace Memorial

title: Devils Postpile National Monument is closed
description: Devils Postpile National Monument and Reds Meadow Road are closed for season; they will not reopen before June 2024.

title: Planning Ahead for Transportation
description: If being dropped off at the park, please ensure you will have a return ride. Taxis and rideshares do not often come out to Congaree, and the bus may be unavailable. Please plan ahead.

title: Seasonal Closing
description: Fort Jay and Castle Williams are closed for the season. Check back on this site for future schedule changes.

title: First Manassas Trail Pedestrian Bridge Closed
description: A pedestrian bridge on the First Manassas loop trail will be closed beginning on 7 November 2023 for repairs. The bridge is located along the eastern leg of the loop.

title: Martin Van Buren NHS's Lindenwald and visitor center are closed for the season
description: Lindenwald is closed for the season beginning November 5, 2023. Lindenwald and the visitor center will reopen for tours in late May 2024. Please check our calendar for further details. The site and trails remain open to the public but are not maintained.
Park Full Name: Martin Van Buren National Historic Site

title: Indoor restrooms and drinking water MAY be unavailable
description: Due to an ongoing upgrade to our water system, the visitor center will be intermittently without potable drinking water or wastewater capabilities. During these times, bottled water and portable toilets are available for visitors.

title: Thompson Memorial A.M.E. Zion Church Restoration
description: The Thompson Memorial A.M.E. Zion Church and parsonage at 47 Parker Street, Auburn, are currently undergoing restoration and rehabilitation. The buildings are closed to the public, but are expected to open in 2024.

title: Park Grounds Are Open Dawn to Dusk
description: Though the historic homes are closed, the park grounds remain open dawn to dusk seven days a week.

title: EV Charger Maintenence
description: As of 11/7/23, the EV Chargers will be turned off until further notice as the system undergoes electrical and mechanical upgrades.

title: Smith Public Use Cabin Closure
description: The Superintendent issued a closure of the Smith/40-Mile Public Use Cabin due to being unsafe for public occupancy as a result of structural damage caused by the 2023 Yukon River break-up and flooding.

title: Seasonal Closures
description: Park grounds are open during daylight hours, but park buildings are closed until Memorial Day weekend. Walkways, trails, and grounds are not currently maintained for public use and may be icy, snow-covered, or uneven. Restrooms are not available.

title: Ride Share Services
description: Convoy Point grounds, Jetty Trail, kayak launch, and picnic area open at 7 a.m. and close at 5:30 p.m. If you are using a ride share service for transportation to and from the park, ensure ride share services can be onsite before closing time.

title: Boca Chita Historic District
description: The Boca Chita Lighthouse will be closed for maintenance until 5/5/2024. The pavilion is also closed while a new roof is installed.

title: Vehicle Entrance Reservation Not Needed
description: Although an entrance pass is required to enter Yellowstone National Park, vehicle reservations are not needed. You are encouraged to purchase an entrance pass before arriving, but you may also purchase passes at any entrance station upon arrival.

title: Restroom Closure At Fritch Fortress
description: The restrooms are now closed for the season at Fritch Fortress Camprounds. Restrooms at Sanford Yake Campgrounds will remain open as well as the vault-evaporator toilets around the park.

title: All vehicles are required to carry tire chains Nov 1 - May 1 when traveling in the park.
description: All vehicles, including 4WD and AWD vehicles, must carry tire chains in the park during the winter season (November 1 - May 1) and be prepared to use them when tire chain requirements are posted.

title: Painted Canyon Visitor Center
description: The Painted Canyon Visitor Center is closed for the season.

title: Paramount Ranch Under Construction (Remains Open)
description: Paramount Ranch will remain open to hikers, cyclists, and equestrians during the project. Construction will occur five days a week—Monday through Friday between 6 a.m. and 5 p.m. No regular work will be performed on weekends or federal holidays.
Park Full Name: Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area

title: Pozo Nuevo Road to Bates Well Ranch High Clearance, 4-Wheel Drive Only
description: High Clearance, 4-wheel drive is required from where Pozo Nuevo Road begins along South Puerto Blanch Drive to Bates Well Ranch area. The road is washed out in areas. Bates Well Ranch is still accessible from the north on Darby Well Road.

title: Construction Impact: Mary Ellen Kramer Park
description: Pathways around the pump & gate houses in Mary Ellen Kramer Park are closed due to construction. Please use the Maple St. Sidewalk & main entrance arch by Hinchliffe Stadium to access the park & waterfall overlook.
Park Full Name: Paterson Great Falls National Historical Park

title: Bandelier Shuttle Service Done For the Season
description: The mandatory shuttle to Bandelier has ended for the 2023 season. Visitors may drive their private vehicles directly to the Bandelier Visitor Center. To avoid parking issues, arrive earlier in the day or later in the afternoon. The park is open until dusk

title: Trailhead Parking Closed for Lind Point and Caneel Hill Trail
description: The parking lot at Lind Point is currently closed due to construction. Hikers can still use the parking lot at the Cruz Bay Visitor Center to access these trails. Permits for visitor center parking spaces can be obtained at the front desk.

title: Winter Season Changes for Campgrounds
description: Starting October 13, water will be shut off for the winter season. South Loop of Cottonwood Campground is closed for the season, but the remaining sites in the North Loop and the entirety of Juniper Campground remain open with winter rates.

title: Highway 244 Closed to Through Traffic
description: Highway 244 will be closed to through traffic from 10/2/23 through no later than 5/3/24. Access to Mt. Rushmore will remain open via U.S. Highway 16A and Highway 244 from the east. A detour will be installed around the project along U.S.

title: Vistor Center and bookstore closed for season
description: The Visitor Center and park bookstore are closed for the season and will reopen Spring 2024.

title: Hopewell Furnace Winter Hours are Now in affect
description: Hopewell Furnace National Historic Site Roads, Visitor Center, and Historic Village are open to the public Wednesday through Sunday regularly for the season. Park grounds are still open daily from sunrise till sunset. Please see https://www.nps.gov/HOFU

title: Closure of Lake View
description: The picnic area, restrooms, and a portion of the parking lot at Lake View Beach will be closed while contractors work on an improvement project. Construction is expected through May 15, 2024, or until further notice, weather permitting.

title: All Visitor Contact Stations Closed
description: Passes are available for purchase online. Click 'more' to buy passes.

title: Be aware of changing beach conditions
description: Beach conditions are changing frequently. Check current tide charts and weather forecasts before traveling on the beach.

title: Current Visiting Requirements
description: Tours of the Roosevelt Home are Thursday-Sunday by advanced reservation only via Recreation.gov. The Old Orchard Museum is open Thursday-Sunday from 11:00am-4:00pm. Trails and grounds open daily.

title: Jefferson Memorial elevator
description: The elevator from the ground level to the chamber of the Jefferson Memorial may be intermittently out of order. Visitors can take steps, but if you require an elevator for a successful visit, please call this number for current status: 202-426-6841.

title: Potable water only at Lehman Caves Visitor Center
description: Potable water is not available at campgrounds at this time. Potable water for filling containers can be found at the Lehman Caves Visitor Center.

title: Winter Hours
description: The Gallatin House is open Saturdays and Sundays October 1 - April 30.

title: Visitor Center Closed for the Winter Season
description: The visitor center is now closed for the season. To request a site tour, call 530-667-8119 at least 2 weeks in advance.

title: Temporary Closure of Chubb Hollow, including pavilion, group sites and trail access
description: A temporary closure of the Chubb Hollow area, including pavilion, group camping sites, and trail access is in effect. This closure is due to renovation of the area in conjunction with the Big Spring Lodge and Cabins project.

title: Vehicle Break-in and Theft Warning
description: Car break-ins in Cuyahoga Valley have tripled since 2022, resulting in theft of personal items like credit cards. Do not leave valuables in your car. As a last resort, lock items in your trunk before arriving. Thieves target parking lots regularly.

title: Road Open To: Mile 13 (Mountain Vista)
description: The Denali Park Road is open to Mile 13, Mountain Vista. Wintry conditions beyond that point prevent vehicle travel, though pedestrian travel is permitted.

title: Restroom Closures
description: The restrooms at the campground and picnic area will be closed in stages during renovation. Portable toilets are available, and one restroom will remain open while the other is being worked on.

title: Reminder: Look Before Parking
description: Visitors are reminded to park in marked parking spaces. Parking in the grass or other alternative areas is unauthorized. Please help us #KeepFortMonroeBeautiful.

title: Tonto National Monument has moved to cashless fee collection
description: Tonto National Monument accepts only electronic card payments for entrance fees. Electronic payment reduces transaction times, saves money, and improves accountability.

title: Natchez Visitor Center Closed
description: The Natchez Visitor Center is closed for the installation of a new HVAC system. For those seeking visitor information, we direct you to the offices of VisitNatchez at 500 Main Street or their website, VisitNatchez.org. We apologize for any inconvenience.

title: new hours of operation
description: Beginning September 10, 2023, The Theodore Roosevelt Birth House will have new hours of operation. The house will be open Wednesday through Sunday, 10am to 4pm.
Park Full Name: Theodore Roosevelt Birthplace National Historic Site

title: Platte River Campground closure May 2024
description: Platte River Campground will be closed for the month of May 2024 while it undergoes pavement preservation. As a result, reservations will not be released for the month of May 2024.

title: Occasional lane closures and traffic delays due to construction at Hwy ZZ & Farm Rd 182
description: Please be advised of potential delays or route obstructions to the Wilson's Creek National Battlefield Entrance from Hwy ZZ starting Monday, September 18th. Entering Wilson's Creek National Battlefield from Farm Road 182 via Battlefield may be faster.

title: Saxton House by Guided Tour Only
description: We offer guided tours of the Saxton House at 10:00am, 12:00pm, and 2:00pm. Tours have a capacity of fifteen people per tour and begin at the Education Center. Tickets are on a first come first serve basis.

title: Spring Creek (Queens) Closed to the Public
description: Spring Creek is closed to the public at this time. The NPS is conducting field investigations as part of a Remedial Investigation at the site. Spring Creek is located in Queens, NYC.

title: Dead Horse Bay (Brooklyn) Remains Closed to the Public
description: The entire southern area of Dead Horse Bay, including Glass Bottle Beach, is closed to the public. Crews are working in these areas using heavy brush clearing equipment and performing radiation surveys. Dead Horse Bay is located in Brooklyn, NYC.

title: Melrose Mansion Guided Tours
description: Reservations for guided tours of the mansion must be made on Recreation.gov. The tour is $11.00 and are at 9, 10, 11, 2, 3, and 4; masks are optional. The estate is open daily from 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. The grounds and outbuildings are free.

title: William Johnson House Reopens!
description: The first floor exhibit hall of the William Johnson House re-opened to the public on Sept. 1. The second floor family living quarters remain closed at this time.

title: Narrows closed to hiking and canyoneering
description: Due to a flow rate of above 150 cfs, the Narrows is currently closed. Riverside Walk (paved trail that starts at the Temple of Sinawava) is open.

title: All Tickets are First-Come, First Served; We Cannot Take Reservations
description: All tickets to the Truman Home and the Truman Farm Home are first-come, first-served. At this time, we are unable to take any reservations for groups. No tickets are issued at the Truman Home itself...all tickets issued at the visitor center.
Park Full Name: Harry S Truman National Historic Site

title: Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail Closure along George Washington Memorial Parkway
description: There is a temporary closure of the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail crossing underneath Glebe Road Bridge due to construction along the George Washington Memorial Parkway. This work is a subsect of the North Parkway rehabilitation.

title: Drinking Water Not Available at Rush Campground
description: Drinking water is not available at Rush Campground. Please plan accordingly if you are planning to camp at Rush or utilize the water spigot before embarking into the Lower Wilderness.

title: Credit/Debit Card Only to pay entrance fees
description: Capulin Volcano only accepts credit/debit cards for entrance fees. Our cooperating association Park Store accepts cash, credit/debit cards, and checks. There are limited cash only entrance passes available through our cooperating association Park Store.

title: Parking is not permitted on the Kyles Landing Road (County Road 56)
description: Parking will no longer be permitted on the road to allow space for emergency vehicles to safely enter the park. There will be ‘No Parking’ signs placed along the Kyles Landing Road, also known as County Road 56.

title: Navigation Warning
description: Some navigation systems on devices misdirect visitors driving to Wilson’s Creek National Battlefield. Please note that the entrance to the park is at the visitor center located near the Southeast intersection of Hwy ZZ and FR 182.

title: 4-wheel drive recommended for beach driving
description: 4-wheel drive is recommended if driving on North and South Beach.

title: Hawai'i Wildfires
description: NPS.gov information page set up for wildfires in Hawai'i.

title: Elevator Outage
description: Due to a mechanical malfunction, our elevator is out of service until further notice. All building tours at this time will require the use of stairs. For questions about tour accessibility, please e-mail LESTM@tenement.org.

title: Drive Cautiously - Endangered Birds on Roadway
description: Nēnē (Hawaiian geese) and ʻuaʻu (Hawaiian petrel) are nesting in the park and may land on or frequent park roads, parking lots, and road leading up to the park. Drivers are reminded to drive at the posted speed limits and exercise caution.

title: Proposal for $1 reservation fee for special events
description: Proposing a $1 reservation fee for after-hours special events, including the popular Torchlight Tours. This $1 reservation fee is necessary to allow for on-line reservations for these programs and to ensure space is available. Open for public comment.

title: Current Trail Access
description: Due to damage from the Tunnel Fire, the Lenox Crater Trail is closed. The A'a, Lava's Edge, and Lava Flow trails are open.

title: Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park
description: You can help prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots. Before leaving your car to catch the ferry: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.

title: Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park
description: You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.

title: Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park
description: You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.

title: Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park
description: You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.

title: Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park
description: You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.

title: Miramontes Trail at Phleger Estate Closed for Public Safety January 2022 Until Trail is Replaced
description: Due to previous storm damage, the trail has been closed until the park can re-route it to a better location. Until construction of a re-route is complete, the trail will be closed.

title: Landline Issues
description: For general information, please call (570) 445-1898 or e-mail stea_visitor_information@nps.gov. To speak with a specific employee, please call their work cell phone directly or e-mail using format firstname_lastname@nps.gov.

title: COVID-19 Mask Requirements
description: Manzanar National Historic Site is located in Inyo County, CA. Check the CDC COVID-19 Hospital Admission Levels tool to learn of masking and safety requirements for your visit.

title: Construction on Exterior of the Saxton Home
description: Areas around the Saxton Home are currently blocked off due to construction. For visitor safety, please stay clear of the home, and begin all visits to the site at the Education Center.

title: Limited Cell Phone Coverage
description: Cell phone voice and data coverage is very limited in the park and surrounding area.

title: Quarai Museum Closed
description: The Quarai museum will be closed until further notice due to an ongoing project within the building.

title: Federal Subsistence Board Closes Fall 2023 Sheep Season in Yukon-Charley Rivers National Preserve
description: The Federal Subsistence Board (Board) approved WSA23-05 to close the sheep season to all users in Yukon-Charley Rivers National Preserve (YUCH) within Units 20E and 25C from August 10 – September 20, 2023.

title: Road Closure at Amistad Acres
description: Due to soil and vegetation damage caused by off-road vehicle travel near Amistad Acres, undesignated dirt loop roads in the area are closed to vehicle traffic until further notice. The area will remain open to foot traffic.

title: Temporary closure of Ringfield and Cheatham Annex pullouts
description: Effective March 2023, Ringfield and Cheatham Annex pullouts and river access will be closed to all visitors until further notice for shoreline stabilization. The Powhatan Village & Indian Field Creek Pullouts remain open as alternate access to York River.

title: Portions of Braddock Road Trail Closed
description: Portions of the Braddock Road Trail at the Indian Run bridge are closed until a new foot bridge is constructed.

title: Fire Closures - Trail, Area, and Camp Closures
description: For closures due to fire activity visit the Fire Closures page, including trail, area, and camp closures for current and post fire conditions.

title: Potomac Heritage National Trail Closed at Glebe Road for construction activities
description: The National Park Service is imposing a temporary closure of a portion of the Potomac Heritage National Trail crossing underneath Glebe Road Bridge during construction activities. This work is a subsect of the North Parkway rehabilitation.

title: Rideshare services should be used with caution if visiting the Tucson Mountain District
description: Rideshare services will drop visitors off at the park, but usually will not pick them back up. To avoid being stranded in the park, coordinate two-way trips before using rideshares to visit the West side. No major trails start at the visitor center.

title: Wildlife Viewing Guidelines
description: San Juan Island National Historical Park provides habitat for many species of animals. When you visit the park, you are visiting their home. Do not approach any wildlife within 75 ft/23 m (two school bus lengths).
Park Full Name: San Juan Island National Historical Park

title: Partial Closure of San Miguel Island Due to Safety Concerns
description: All trails and facilities on San Miguel Island, except the sandy beaches of Cuyler Harbor, are closed to the public until emergency repairs can be made to Nidever Canyon Trail. Completion is anticipated for summer 2024.

title: Sat & Sun 10 am-4:30pm IF parking is full, entrance closes, no entrance until parking available.
description: Saturdays & Sundays 10 am-4:30 pm, with good weather, IF our parking lots fill we close the park entrance. (Georgetown Pike & Old Dominion Dr) We re-open when parking is available. No waiting, no street parking. Updates at Great Falls Park Facebook page.

title: Yellow Jacket (Vespula) Wasp Activity
description: Be aware of aggressive ground-nesting vespula wasps. When threatened, leave the area. If stung and you begin to experience serious symptoms or allergic reactions, call 911.

title: Equestrian Trails Open
description: All equestrian trails are open, except for area around the northern most bridge due to structural safety. See the equestrian map below.

title: Slant Rock Road Closed to Vehicular Traffic
description: Due to washout and bad road conditions Slant Rock Road has been closed to all traffic aside from hikers and bikers. To access Slant Rock, park your vehicle at the hunting inspection station off of Road 103.

title: Partial Trail Closure at Portage Lakefront and Riverwalk
description: Closed portion of Portage Lakefront and Riverwalk Trail along Burns Waterway due to unsafe conditions from erosional damage. This trail portion will remain closed while funding is sought for repair work. Pier access remains open on either side of closure.

title: HEAT ADVISORY - Be sure to Carry Plenty of Water!
description: The park wishes to advise all visitors to carry plenty of water for themselves (1 quart per person) and any pets as well.

title: Green Trail Closed
description: A portion of the Green Trail at the Theodore Roosevelt Area is closed to public access until further notice due to excess erosion.

title: A Short Walk is Required to Reach the Fort
description: A 1/4 mile (1,275 feet) walk on a paved trail from the parking area is required to reach the gate of the fort. At the end of your visit, you'll return to your vehicle along the same path.
Park Full Name: Bent's Old Fort National Historic Site

title: Wilderness Permits Now Only Available Online
description: Wilderness permits for backcountry camping can no longer be obtained in person or by mail. Wilderness permits are only available online through Recreation.gov. Permits can be reserved up to a maximum of 90 days prior to the start date.

title: South Unit Road from the Old East Entrance station mile near marker 22 to mile marker 28
description: Due to major road repair work, the former scenic loop between the Old East Entrance Station (near mile marker 22) and mile marker 28 is closed to all traffic, including pedestrian, and bicycle access.

title: Spring Creek Landing Closed to Vehicle-Assisted Launches
description: The Spring Creek Landing has been closed to vehicle-assisted launches. Watercraft may still be put in and take out at this point, but must be hand carried to and from the parking area. This is to ensure the safety of visitors and avoid continued erosion.

title: Potentially hazardous and unhealthy Air Quality Index levels
description: Potentially hazardous and unhealthy Air Quality Index levels are present in Washington due to smoke from wildfires burning in Canada. Find out what you can do to protect your health and plan your visit accordingly:

title: See TRSite.org for the latest updates on the tour schedule.
description: See TRSite.org for the latest updates on the tour schedule.
Park Full Name: Theodore Roosevelt Inaugural National Historic Site

title: Kalawao County Restrictions
description: Access to the park, including Kalawao County, the Kalaupapa Trail, the settlement, and Waikolu Valley, is restricted to residents and visitors with approved permits issued by Hawaii State Department of Health. Violations will result in arrest/fine.

title: Visitor Center Relocated
description: Due to an ongoing renovation project, the visitor center has been moved to a temporary location. Services such as the museum and movie will be unavailable at this time but services such as public restroom and park stamps will be available.

title: Closed trail bridge at Zion Lodge (Shuttle Stop #5)
description: To access Emerald Pools, start your hike at the Court of the Patriarchs (Shuttle Stop #4) or the Grotto (Shuttle Stop #6). This does not affect other trailheads or the Zion Canyon Shuttle System.

title: Drone Use Prohibited
description: The launching, landing, and operation of drones is prohibited on all lands and waters administered by the National Park Service. Drones negatively impact other visitors and wildlife and interfere with fire fighting and other emergency operations.

title: If You Can't Reach Us By Phone, Please Email Us
description: Please call 208-933-4105 to talk to a park ranger. However, if the phone lines are down, contact a ranger through email at hafo_information@nps.gov

title: Walking Bridge Over the Falls CLOSED
description: Due to safety concerns the footbridge crossing the Passaic River is indefinitely closed, pending replacement. To access Mary Ellen Kramer Park, foot traffic may use the Wayne Ave. Bridge & Maple St. - parking on Maple St. is limited.
Park Full Name: Paterson Great Falls National Historical Park

title: Rose Farm Rehabilitation Project Closure Notice
description: As of May 3, 2023, the Rose Farm & Rose Lane are closed to all visitation. The house will undergo a full rehabilitation. This work prohibits the use of the area around the house and lane during construction. Worker safety and resource protection are key.

title: Backcountry vehicle route closed for the season
description: The full backcountry vehicle route remains closed for the winter season until May 15. Vehicle access is limited to the Cabin District.

title: Health and Safety
description: Masks are not required but are strongly recommended for all Museum visitors. Children under the age of 5 are not permitted on in-person building tours, but are welcome to attend a neighborhood walking tour or visit us virtually.

title: Trail Work on Maryland Heights--Trail OPEN
description: Due to trail improvements, use caution when hiking the Maryland Heights Trail. Trail work is expected to be ongoing through June, and will involve dump trucks and a skid steer. The trail will remain OPEN, although it may require short delays to hikers.

title: Painted Hills- Large RV or Travel Trailer not Recommended Beyond Overlook Trail
description: Don’t get your vehicle stuck at the Painted Hills! We want you and your RV or large bus to enjoy your trip. Travel trailers or large buses are not recommended beyond the Overlook Trail at Painted Hills due to limited turning radius.
Park Full Name: John Day Fossil Beds National Monument

title: No Boundary Access to Pocosin Hollow Trail
description: Boundary access to Pocosin Hollow Trail off State Rt. 667 is no longer available.

title: Riprap Boundary Access Closure
description: Public access to the Riprap trail system at the park boundary via Wild Turkey Lane is no longer available due to private landowner concerns. Please use Skyline Drive to access this trail system.

title: Ongoing Storm Damage Closures
description: Ongoing list of closures related to previous storm damage for public safety: Devils Island Dock & Campsite; West Bay Club on Sand Island.

title: Sagamore Hill is Cashless
description: Cash payments at Sagamore Hill are no longer accepted as a method of payment for National Parks and Federal Recreational Lands Passes. Credit and Debit Cards are accepted.

title: Water Hazards Present
description: Due to decreasing water levels, underwater hazards are present in the lake. Please be extra vigilant for potential damage to boat or other injury.

title: Most Monument Roads Require Heavy Duty 4WD Vehicle to Travel Safely
description: Breaking down in the remote monument can be a life-threatening emergency. Most roads require a well-equipped, heavy-duty 4WD vehicle to travel. 2WD high clearance vehicles must use Walking Box Ranch Rd for entry and exit. No Visitor Facilities Available.

title: Historic Carriage Roads open to pedestrians only
description: Acadia's historic carriage roads are now open only to pedestrians. They remain closed to all other uses, such has cycling and horses, to protect them during spring thaw, also known as “mud season.” Watch for further updates as conditions allow.

title: Anchoring Permit Required for All Vessels
description: Anchoring is allowed only by permit and only in the designated location on the west side of Buck Island. Permits are free, valid for one year and available at the Danish West India & Guinea Company Building.

title: Roadwork may cause delays on US 41/Tamiami Trail
description: Current roadwork is ongoing along the park's northern boundary on US Highway 41/Tamiami Trail to raise the road for Everglades Restoration benefits. Drivers may experience up to 15-minute delays and should watch for personnel, equipment and slow downs.

title: Mount Tamalpais State Park - Trail Conditions
description: Many trails in Muir Woods connect to trails in Mount Tamalpais State Park. For up-to-date information about trail conditions within State Park boundaries, check the Mount Tamalpais State Park Info page (click more) and scroll down to Trail Updates.

title: Cranberry Creek to Locator Lake Trail is Closed.
description: The Cranberry Creek to Locator Lake trail is closed until further notice due to beaver damming and flooding which is making the trail impassable. Signs are posted at the trail entrance.

title: Salmi Road Entrance to the Kab-Ash Trail out of the Kabetogama Community Remains Temporarily Closed.
description: Salmi Road entrance to the Kab-Ash Trail remains temporarily closed at the trail's western most terminus. Access to the trail remains open at trailheads along Ash River Trail road, Meadwood Road, and the eastern terminus within the community of Ash River.

title: Visitor Center Closed
description: The Salt River Bay NHP&EP Visitor Contact station remains closed due to damage caused by Hurricanes Irma/Maria.
Park Full Name: Salt River Bay National Historical Park and Ecological Preserve
Type of Unit: National Historic Park and Ecological Preserve

title: The Steeple Building Closed
description: The Steeple Building remains closed until further notice.

title: Hospital Street Restrooms Closed
description: The public restrooms on Hospital Street are closed. Temporary restrooms have been placed in the parking lot of Fort Christiansvaern.

title: County Line Road Closed Monday To Friday
description: County Line Road is closed during the week, from Monday through Friday. The closure will apply to all vehicular, pedestrian, and bicycle traffic. Please find an alternate route.

title: Roosevelt Campobello International Park is located in Welshpool.
description: Campobello Island is located in the province of New Brunswick, Canada. The physical address for the Visitor Centre is: 459 Route 774 Welshpool, New Brunswick, Canada E5E 1A4

title: Passaic River Trail Bridge washed out
description: Tropical Storm Ida washed out the Passaic River bridge on the Patriot's Path Trail south of Tempe Wick Road. This area is a known habitat of the endangered wood turtle, so do not wade, walk, or let your dog run in the river at this location.

title: Volcano Road Closed to RVs and Buses over 26 feet, and to all Trailers.
description: The Volcano top road is not accessible to RVs, buses, attached trailers, or any other vehicle over 26 feet in length, due to the narrowness and weight limits of Volcano Road. Trailer drop off and RV/bus parking is available at the Visitor Center.

title: No Visitor Vehicle Access to the Park Site
description: Eugene O'Neill NHS is only accessible by free park shuttle or by hiking trails through Las Trampas Regional Wilderness. Details under permits and Reservations.

title: Park Closed on Mondays, Tuesdays, and Wednesdays.
description: Thomas Stone National Historic Site is closed on Mondays, Tuesdays, and Wednesdays. The park is open Thursday through Sunday, 10:00 - 4:00 pm.

title: Some facilities closed along the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail
description: Please see our partner sites to find the most up-to-date information on closures, re-routes, or conditions along the Trail.

title: Avoid flash floods
description: Flash floods are a sudden increase in the depth and speed of water in rivers, streams, or washes due to rain. Flood waters carry large debris like tree trunks and boulders and can happen at any time in Zion.

title: Diablo Lake Boat Launch Inaccessible to Powerboats
description: Due to silt accumulation, the Diablo Lake boat launch at Colonial Creek South Campground is not usable for launching most powerboats. Expect shallow or no water at the launch ramp and the possibility of needing to carry your boat to or from the water.

title: Former Golf Course Property
description: The former golf course property in Peninsula, including a section of the Valley Trail, is closed during environmental remediation.

title: Park Closed Tuesdays and Wednesdays
description: The visitor center and all park trails are closed on Tuesdays and Wednesdays. Open Thursday through Monday, from 9 am - 5 pm. Hiking park trails is not permitted when the park is closed.

title: SEASONAL SAFETY MESSAGE
description: Be careful and safe while out in the canyon! Be cautious of your surroundings, don't cliff jump, don't stray off of the main trails, and don't get too close to Little River Falls or the canyon rim. These activities could result in injury or death.

title: Fort Davis NHS is a NO DRONE Zone!
description: The use of drones is prohibited at Fort Davis National Historic Site. Thank you for preserving the cultural landscape.

title: Fort Davis NHS is in the Central Time Zone
description: Fort Davis National Historic Site is located in the Central Time Zone. The park is open 8:00 am until 5:00 pm (Central Time). The Visitor Center closes at 4:30pm. The Main Gate locks at 5:00pm.

title: Toxic Cyanobacteria in the Virgin River and the streams of Zion National Park
description: Do not submerge your head in or filter drinking water from still or moving water.

title: Dogs Not allowed on ocean beaches in Jamaica Bay and Sandy Hook March 15- Sept. 15
description: Dogs are not allowed on ocean beaches at Sandy Hook between March 15 through September 15. Dogs are not allowed on the ocean beaches at Jacob Riis Park, Fort Tilden, Breezy Point Tip and at the bayside of Breezy Point between March 15 through September 15

title: Old Courthouse Closed for Renovations
description: The Old Courthouse at Gateway Arch National Park is undergoing renovations as part of the $380-million CityArchRiver project, which is the largest public-private partnership in the history of the National Park Service. It is closed to all visitors.

title: Vehicle Break-Ins
description: Saguaro National Park is an urban park. Vehicle break-ins have occurred at trailheads around the park. Don't make yourself a target. Leave valuables at home, secure your vehicle, and report any suspicious activity.

title: Temporary Blackland Prairie Trail Closure to Equestrians
description: Heavy rain has undermined a culvert making it unsafe for passage. Due to horse trailer parking availability, the entire section is closed to equestrians. Hikers are still able to travel from the railroad tracks to the Parkway Visitor Center.

title: Phased Reopening and Outdoor Programming
description: We are increasing access to the parks in phases. Beginning 1/15/2023, visitor centers at Cowpens and Kings Mountain will open 9 – 5 on Wed – Sun. Grounds & restrooms open daily 9 – 5.

title: Avoid area around the church & under trees in high wind conditions
description: In high wind conditions (sustained winds of 25 mph and above) visitors are advised to avoid the area around the church, with the possibility of falling clay tiles from the roof, and the cemetery, possibility of falling tree branches or limbs. Thank you.
Park Full Name: Saint Paul's Church National Historic Site

title: Giftshop closed the last Tuesday of every month
description: The giftshop will be closed the last Tuesday of every month for inventory.

title: Wupatki VC Phone Outages
description: The main phone line for the visitor center experiences occasional outages. Please call 928-856-1705 if you have trouble getting through on the main number.

title: Special Use Permits
description: Special Use Permits are typically needed for activities that benefit a specific group. Examples include: Groups of 40 or more, trips organized by scouting groups, churches, or academic institutions, photography, weddings, and first amendment activities

title: Weather Advisory and Storm Warnings
description: The park may have delayed openings or closures in the event of severe weather. Travel may not be recommended during these times. Please check local weather forecasts. We appreciate your understanding.

title: Weather Advisory and Storm Warnings
description: The park may have delayed openings or closures in the event of severe weather. Travel may not be recommended during these times. Please check local weather forecasts. We appreciate your understanding.

title: Weather Advisory and Storm Warnings
description: The park may have delayed openings or closures in the event of severe weather. Travel may not be recommended during these times. Please check local forecasts. We appreciate your understanding.
Park Full Name: Hubbell Trading Post National Historic Site

title: Angels Landing Pilot Permit Program
description: Everyone who hikes Angels Landing needs to have a permit. Learn why you need a permit and how to get one. This requirement does not affect entering the park or riding the park shuttle (when it is running).

title: Park Closed to the Public
description: The park is currently closed to the public. If you would like learn more about Honouliuli when visiting O‘ahu, you can visit our partner at the Japanese Cultural Center of Hawai‘i in Honolulu.

title: Wind Cave moves to cashless fee collection
description: Payments for cave tours, campground fees, as well as Interagency Passes at Wind Cave National Park, will be by credit/ debit cards or digital payments only. Cash and check payments will no longer be accepted.

title: For entrance fees, we accept digital passes and credit/debit cards
description: Digital passes or credit/debit cards are the ONLY method of payment at all fee collection areas. Pre-paid digital passes are available online and may be purchased in advance.

title: Be Aware of Illegal Traffic
description: Smuggling and/or illegal entry is common in this area due to the proximity of the international border. Please be aware of your surroundings at all times and do not travel alone in remote areas.

title: Building Closures - Historic Preservation
description: There are a few projects underway. From time to time this may require that we close certain areas or structures for the protection of our staff, visitors, and park resources. We appreciate your understanding while we perform this critical work.

title: Pacific Arch closed through February 23
description: The Pacific Arch will be closed for maintenance through Feb 23. During this time, pedestrian access to the memorial is through the Atlantic Arch or ceremonial entrance on 17th Street. The accessible entrance is via the Atlantic Arch.

title: 1/15/2023 - Increasing Access to Visitor Center and Museum
description: Beginning Sunday, Jan. 15, 2023, the visitor center at Cowpens NB will be open daily Wednesday to Sunday from 9:00 am to 5:00 pm. Restrooms and park grounds are open 7 days per week, except on federal holidays specified in the superintendent’s compendium.

title: Green River Ferry Status
description: The Green River Ferry Status can change without advanced warning. For the most up-to-date ferry status information please call the Green River Ferry Hotline at (270) 758-2166 or follow the Mammoth Cave Roads and Ferry Twitter feed. 2 vehicle limit.

title: The North Shoreline is Closed
description: The shoreline is closed permanently for resource protection and visitor safety.

title: Walnut Canyon National Monument Hours and Trail Information
description: Walnut Canyon is open daily from 9:00-5:00. The Island Trail is open from 9:00-4:00 and the Rim Trail is open from 9:00-4:30. Hikers must begin the trails before their closure times. There is no access to park trails, viewpoints or facilities after hours.

title: South Cut trail Partially Closed
description: South Cut Trail is closed between the main road and Killman Field trail due to washout along the trail. Detour for that section is along Killman Field trail. South Cut trail from Killman Field trail to the beach is open.

title: Migrant Notice
description: Like elsewhere in the Florida Keys, we have recently seen an increase in Cuban migrants arriving by boat from Cuba and landing on the islands of Dry Tortugas National Park. You may observe migrant landings at the park and visitor areas may be impacted.

title: Masks are currently NOT REQUIRED when visiting Montezuma Castle National Monument
description: Requirements are dependent upon Community Level and based on data provided by the Centers for Disease Control & Prevention (CDC) for counties where the park is located. Yavapai County is currently LOW and Masks are NOT REQUIRED inside Federal Buildings.

title: Masks are currently NOT REQUIRED when visiting Tuzigoot National Monument
description: Requirements are dependent upon Community Level and based on data provided by the Centers for Disease Control & Prevention (CDC) for counties where the park is located. Yavapai County is currently LOW and Masks are NOT REQUIRED inside Federal Buildings.

title: Big Bend is a NO DRONE Zone
description: The use of drones is prohibited in Big Bend National Park. Thank you for preserving the peace and tranquility of Big Bend.

title: Casa Grande Ruins National Monument is Fee Free
description: Casa Grande Ruins National Monument no longer charges a fee to enter the monument. The annual and senior passes are no longer available for purchase, however we are still able to issue the free passes.

title: William Floyd Estate
description: The Old Mastic House is closed for renovations until further notice.

title: Municipal Pier at Aquatic Park is closed due to safety concerns.
description: Municipal Pier is closed permanently. After a safety review with the U.S. Public Health Service, it was determined that the deterioration of Municipal Pier in Aquatic Park Cove is unsafe for public use.
Park Full Name: San Francisco Maritime National Historical Park

title: Devil's Hall is a Strenuous Hike
description: The hike to Devil's Hall is rated as strenuous. The portion of the route in the wash requires rock scrambling and is dangerous when wet or if water is present. The wash surface is loose gravel and rocks and may be unstable.

title: Park Unit Closures and Reopenings
description: The Prairie Acadian Cultural Center in Eunice is closed. However, this site does have some outdoor programs. See the Calendar for event information. Some trails at the Barataria Preserve remain closed. Click "more" below for further information.
Park Full Name: Jean Lafitte National Historical Park and Preserve

title: Reduced Speed Limit on North Parkway
description: The speed limit on the northern section of the parkway has been reduced to 40 MPH in the work zone during the rehabilitation project. Click the link to sign up for updates on the project.

title: All Lava Tube Caves Closed for the Season
description: All lava tube caves are closed for the season and no cave permits will be issued at this time.
Park Full Name: Craters of the Moon National Monument and Preserve

title: Center grass panel fenced off for over-seeding at Lincoln Park
description: The National Park Service is improving grassy areas at Lincoln Park by aerating the soil and over-seeding the center grass panel. Fencing has been erected until the seeding has taken in the center panel.

title: Faraway Ranch House Closure
description: The Faraway Ranch Historic House is currently closed for restoration. No tours are being offered at this time.

title: Pet Policy
description: Pets are not allowed inside the visitor center at Aztec Ruins, nor are they allowed on the archaeological trail through Aztec West. Pets are welcome in the parking lot, the picnic area, and along the Old Spanish Trail. Service animals are the exception.

title: Park in Progress
description: Blackwell School NHS is working toward establishment and is not yet an official park. Visitor services are very limited. For more information on how to visit, please visit our FAQ page.

title: Heavy Construction Vehicle Operations & Limited Amphitheater Accessibility
description: Heavy construction vehicles are operating through the parking lot & Lower Overlook Park - use caution & be vigilant for hazards. Lower Overlook & Amphitheater access is via stairs only for construction duration.
Park Full Name: Paterson Great Falls National Historical Park

title: Birthplace Unit Open Daily!
description: The Birthplace Visitors Center is open daily 9:00am to 5pm (ET) and the Memorial Building is open daily from 9:00am to 4:30pm (ET) Please be sure to ask about the Jr. Ranger Program for kids!
Park Full Name: Abraham Lincoln Birthplace National Historical Park

title: Oakland Main House Self-Guided Tours
description: The interior of the Oakland Main House is ONLY open to the public on weekends from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. All tours of the house are self-guided and occupancy within the building is limited. Please plan accordingly.
Park Full Name: Cane River Creole National Historical Park

title: Camp only in campgrounds
description: If you camp in a vehicle in an area that is not a designated campground, you may get a citation. Learn more about opportunities to camp in Zion.

title: Ongoing work on Lower Town buildings
description: Facilities staff are doing repair work on several buildings in Lower Town. Please follow signs for alternate entrances and heed temporary closures.

title: Landing at Hwy 137
description: The highway 137 bridge landing sustained flood damage in 2019 and the landing restoration by NDOT has been completed. The area is smaller than in the past and the access to the water is steeper. Use caution when accessing the landing

title: Park Operations Altered Due to Pretty Rocks Landslide
description: Summer access to facilities and services in Denali remains altered due to the Pretty Rocks Landslide and the associated closure of the Park Road at Mile 43. Check here for more information on what to expect.

title: Face Masks Optional
description: The NPS face mask guidance is based on the CDC’s COVID-19 Community Levels tool. Face masks are currently optional at Chattahoochee River National Recreation Area, however you are welcome to wear a mask if it makes you more comfortable.

title: Boater Awareness
description: Please use caution in park waters due to navigational markers that may be missing or moved due to unforeseen circumstances.

title: Expect long lines to enter the park
description: Between March and November, particularly on busy holiday weekends, you may experience long lines at the entrance road. Parking lots at popular trailheads and viewpoints will fill early. Pack your patience and arrive early to avoid crowds.

title: Louisiana Circle Closed
description: Louisiana Circle is closed to vehicles and pedestrians due to slope instability. Navy Circle is open and also provides views of the Mississippi River.

title: Ancestral Chamber temporarily closed
description: Several features within the Monument’s outdoor memorial are temporarily closed due to safety concerns. The Ancestral Chamber is showing signs of stress and must be assessed prior to reopening. See https://www.nps.gov/afbg/learn/news/temp-closure-ac.htm

title: Use Caution on Roads with Debris
description: Flooding has resulted in debris along many roads within the park boundaries. Please use caution when driving on paved roads and watch for road crews at work. Be aware that unimproved and dirt roads may be impassible due to washouts, so plan accordingly.

title: Use Caution with GPS Navigation
description: The new visitor center is located at 17970 US Hwy 30, about one mile north of downtown Hagerman and the old visitor center. Highway signs and GPS navigation may not yet be up-to-date.

title: Covid-19 Response
description: Federal guidelines require masks be worn inside the Whitman Mission National Historic Site Visitor Center while the CDCs COVID-19 Community Level tool shows "High" in Walla Walla County. Check the tool on Fridays to see updates

title: Difficult conditions complicate Cataract Canyon takeouts
