description: Click "more" to find out if the East Rim Trail is open for today. In good conditions trail is open 6:00 a.m. - 11:00 p.m. for bikers and as posted for other trail users. In wet or hazardous conditions, the trail will close to all users to prevent damage.

title: Winter Closure Hotline
description: With winter weather a possibility, Springfield Armory has set up a Weather Delay/Closure hotline for up to the minute information. Please call 413-734-8551 then enter extension 300 for weather updates.

title: Vehicle Break-Ins: Take precautions to secure your vehicle and valuables.
description: This is an urban park. Don't hide valuables inside your car. Carry items with you on hike. Lock your vehicle and set car alarm. Recent auto break-ins at Rinconada Canyon parking lot. Report suspicious persons loitering/peeking in cars. Call 928-638-7805

title: Wild Bison
description: Bison graze in both Windmill and West Traps pastures. Sightings may be at schoolhouse parking area. Bison will defend themselves if they feel threatened. Keep 100 yards distance. A raised tail is a warning sign: bison may charge or give chase.

title: Be Aware of Break-ins along State Route 20
description: Prevent smashed windows and theft. Break-ins are not uncommon at trailheads along State Route 20. Remove your valuables and electronics and take associated electronic cords.

title: Weir House, Weir Studio, Young Studio, Visitor Center, and Restrooms Closed
description: Please note starting November 1st all park buildings are closed for the season. Park grounds are open daily year-round and maps, brochures, and passport stamp are available in the parking lot kiosk. Restrooms are not available during the off-season.

title: Melting snow bridges and high streamflows create hazards for hikers, skiers, and snowshoers.
description: Be aware of hidden- and potentially fatal- hazards created by snow bridges and high streamflows on Mount Rainier.

title: Being Prepared for a Wilderness Experience
description: Some of the park's trails require advanced navigation (compass & maps), climbing over downed trees & crossing through water. Please choose trails that fit your preferences & abilities. Visit the Trail Information page to learn more about the park's trails

title: If you have been redirected from the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail Route
description: You were redirected to this site from the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail Route because of a sunset clause in the Trail's federal legislation, the NPS lost its legislative authority to manage the trail after 9-30-2011.

title: Kentucky Boyhood Home at Knob Creek Unit Visitor Center has Seasonal Hours
description: The Knob Creek Visitor Center and Knob Creek Cabin are closed for winter season. The grounds at the Kentucky Boyhood Home at Knob Creek Unit are open from sunrise to sunset. The Visitor Center at the Birthplace Unit and Symbolic Cabin are open year round.
Park Full Name: Abraham Lincoln Birthplace National Historical Park

title: Turkey Hunting Active: 4/15 - 5/5/2024
description: The spring turkey firearm season is now active in Ozark National Scenic Riverways. Hunters are reminded to follow all state/park regulations, and other visitors should wear bright clothes if hiking in remote areas.

title: Campground Reservation Window Changed for 2024
description: Reservable sites are now only available by reservation. Reservations must be made through recreation.gov (online or by calling). Visitors should not occupy these sites without a prior reservation.

title: Big Cypress National Preserve Issues Temporary Area Closure for Interceptor Prescribed Fire
description: Big Cypress National Preserve has issued a temporary closure during prescribed fire activity beginning Sunday, April, 21, 2024. To learn more about what areas and activities the closure entails, click the link!

title: Closure of Pulltite Cabin: Effective 07/19/23 until further notice
description: Around the Pulltite Cabin, a 100’ perimeter extending in all directions has been closed to the public. Closure of the area is deemed necessary as a large tree has fallen on the structure, causing damage.

title: Select Roads Open to Regular Vehicles
description: West Entrance to Old Faithful, Mammoth Hot Springs to Old Faithful, and Norris Junction to Canyon Village are open for the summer season. Additional park roads will open throughout May, weather permitting.

title: Volcano Road Closure April 22-April 25 May 8 May 15 or 16
description: Volcano Road will be closed for construction April 22 through April 25, and short closures May 8, and May 15 or 16. The Visitor Center, Park Film, Museum, Boca and Lava Flow trails, and Bookstore will all be open.

title: Prescribed Burns in Stafford Beach area on 4/19 and Plum Orchard area on 4/20
description: Stafford Beach Campground will be closed on 4/19 for prescribed burns. Plum Orchard will remain open for their burn on 4/20. For the full press release, click the following link https://www.nps.gov/cuis/learn/news/prescribed-burns.htm.

title: Traffic Disruptions
description: Please note: On Saturday, April 20, 2024, Rome, NY is expected to experience traffic disruptions. During this time, those with handicapped plates may park in front of the visitor center. All others should use the lot at 112 E Park St. Be prepared to walk.

title: What's Closed and What's Open? (Park Operational Updates) Friday, April 19, 2024
description: Visitor Center is OPEN today. It will be closed between April 21 and May 4 for staff training. Visit the link for available visitor services/hours of operation. The North Rim of the park and SR 67 remain CLOSED to all vehicle traffic until May 15.

title: Friday, April 19, 2024 - Mostly Sunny, Today with a South Rim High of 72°F (22°C)
description: Bright Angel Trail has reopened for public use. Water is on at Havasupai Gardens; however, water remains off at 1.5 and 3-Mile Resthouses. No potable water beyond Phantom Ranch on North Kaibab Trail due to a waterline break on 4/17. Visit link for details

title: US HWY 50 CLOSURE ALERT - as of April 18, 2024
description: Colorado Department of Transportation has closed US Highway 50 near Dillon Pinnacles, between Black Canyon NP and Curecanti NRA (mile marker 136 to 138), for emergency maintenance on the bridge. Check https://www.cotrip.org/home for updates.
Park Full Name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park

title: US 50 Emergency Closure
description: Colorado Department of Transportation has closed US 50 between County Road 26 and Elk Creek Road (18 to 20 miles west of Gunnison) from Mile Point 136 to Mile Point 138. Road closed expect delays due to road maintenance operations, no reopening date yet.

title: Delassus-Kern House and Grounds Closed
description: Due to hazardous conditions, the Delassus-Kern House and surrounding grounds are closed indefinitely.

title: Bauvais-Amoureux House and Grounds Closed
description: The Bauvais-Amoureux House and grounds are currently closed for a roofing project.

title: Seasonal Road Closures
description: The Wheeler Peak Scenic Drive is closed for the season at mile three at the Upper Lehman Campground. Both the Snake Creek and Strawberry Creek Roads are closed for the season.

title: Historic Homes Closed for Winter Season
description: The historic homes are closed for the winter season and unavailable for tours. The 2024 season begins May 1 and ends October 31. The Visitor Center is open 10am-4pm Monday-Friday.

title: Paradise Road Status: Road open 24 hours, weather dependent.
description: Regular nightly closure of the gate to Paradise at Longmire has ended for the season. The road can still close at any time due to weather/road conditions. All vehicles are still required to carry tire chains until May 1.

title: Restrooms at Henry Hill Are Closed
description: Until further notice, the restrooms at the Henry Hill Visitor Center are closed. Visitors may use the restrooms at Brownsville (2 miles from Henry Hill) or at park headquarters located at Stuarts Hill (3 miles from Henry Hill).

title: Facilities Openings Delayed
description: Due to extensive wind damage, power has not been restored to Elkwallow Wayside and Mathews Arm Campground. Openings are delayed.

title: Intermittent power outages at Big Meadows
description: Starting April 9, there will be intermittent power outages Mondays through Thursdays in the Big Meadows area for the next three weeks due to repairs. Outages will affect campground showers. The visitor center and wayside have generators.

title: Tree blocking trail/bridge along 24-Gun Battery Trail.
description: A large tree has fallen and destroyed a bridge along the 24-Gun Battery Trail, west of Old Mountain Road. Crossing at this section would be dangerous and should be avoided.

title: Sunday, April 21 - Park Entrance and Tour Roads Temporarily Closed for Rev Run
description: The park entrance and tour roads will be closed the morning of Sunday, April 21 from 4:30 AM to 11 AM during the Rev Run event. Rt 23 and Rt 252 will remain open through the park. Washington's Headquarters to open at 9 AM this day.

title: Short-Term Parking Lot Closures
description: Spring cleaning parking lot closures will occur for 2 hours from 6 a.m. to 8 a.m. Monday, April 22: Visitor Center Tuesday, April 23: Sunrise Point Wednesday, April 24: Sunset Point Thursday, April 25: Bryce Point Monday, April 29: Inspiration Point

title: Road Construction Closures
description: Fritch Fortress is closed to the visiting public due to road construction. There is no public access.

title: Slide on Southside Trail
description: A rockslide has occurred on the Southside Trail near the Arbuckle Connector Trail junction. The trail is closed at that junction. The remainder of the trail is still open.
Park Full Name: New River Gorge National Park and Preserve

title: Administration Parking Lot Closed Fri 4/19 to Sun 4/21 at Noon for Rev Run Setup
description: The upper parking lot near the administration building will be temporarily closed starting the morning of Friday, Apr 19 for setup activities related to the Rev Run event. The parking lot will reopen after the race on Sunday, Apr 21 at approx noon.

title: Prescribed Burn
description: Beginning April 17, 2024, there will be a prescribed burn around Sanford Yake and Cedar Canyon.

title: Road Damage
description: Due to damage from heavy rains, some roads may require high clearance or 4x4 vehicles for passage. Please use caution when approaching and driving on roadways. Trailers over 30 ft not advised.

title: Harpers Corner Road is Closed for Winter
description: The Harpers Corner Road in Colorado is closed at Moffat County Road 16, approximately thirteen miles from US HWY 40. Access to the Dinosaur Quarry in the Utah portion of the monument is open all winter.

title: Staircase to Little Hunter's Beach closed until further notice
description: Due to damage and unsafe conditions caused by recent storms, a staircase and access route from the Park Loop Road to Little Hunter's Beach is closed until further notice. Park staff are working to address issues there over coming weeks.

title: Park Shuttle Available!
description: The pedestrian bridge at the main entrance to the park is closed. Visitors must now walk a .7 mile steep detour to the Sandburg Home and farm. An accessible daily shuttle runs every 20 minutes, from 9:40 am to 4:20 pm, from the main parking lot.
Park Full Name: Carl Sandburg Home National Historic Site

title: Pedestrian Bridge at Front Lake is Closed
description: The pedestrian bridge at the main entrance to the park is closed. A 6-passenger accessible shuttle runs daily every 20 minutes from 9:40 am to 4:20 pm, from the main parking lot, on Little River Road, to the Sandburg Home and farm area.
Park Full Name: Carl Sandburg Home National Historic Site

title: Flooding
description: All trails are open; however, hikers may encounter downed trees, washouts, and damaged boardwalks as a result of flooding on April 10. Areas along major waterways may still be flooded. Paddling is not advised. Contact the visitor center for updates.

title: Bookstore Closed For Inventory
description: The Salt Pond Visitor Center bookstore in Eastham will be closed on Tuesday, April 23 for inventory.

title: El Malpais Visitor Center closed May 13-15
description: The El Malpais Visitor Center will be closed on Monday, May 13, through Wednesday, May 15, 2024, for seasonal staff training. The park's roads and hiking trails are all open to visit while the visitor center is closed. Thank you for your understanding.

title: Little Rock Central High School National Historic Site visitor center closures - April 2024
description: The Central High School NHS Visitor Center is open Tues. to Sat. (10 a.m. CST/CDT to 4 p.m. CST/CDT). Guests may visit the NHS daily; use the NPS App for digital content on days when the visitor center is closed. Alerts will be posted with info as needed
Park Full Name: Little Rock Central High School National Historic Site

title: Prescribed Fire Operations
description: Fire management will be conducting prescribed fire operations beginning Thursday April 18, in the northeast corner of the park, just south of Chekika. No closures are anticipated, however smoke may be visible from Krome Ave and US41.

title: Newfound Gap Road Construction near Gatlinburg Entrance
description: Single-lane closures starting week of April 15

title: Lakeview Drive Construction
description: Temporary single-lane closures until early July for paving; Noland Creek Bridge closed April 15 to April 18 for bridge repair

title: Spring 2024 Prescribed Fire Notice at Lake Roosevelt
description: Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area may implement the following prescribed burn during the spring of 2024.

title: Seasonal Road Closure - Kolob Terrace Road past Black Canyon
description: Kolob Terrace Road closed to non-tracked vehicles past Black Canyon (15 miles north of SR-9) due to snow and ice.

title: NPS 300 Road Conditions
description: NPS 300 to Big Tubes is muddy in spots with some two-foot-deep ruts. A four-wheel-drive, high clearance vehicle is required.

title: Click on "caution" alerts below for important details on accessing the park
description: Roads to the park have delays from construction and Shark Valley parking lot is regularly filling to capacity from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. with wait times of up to 2 hours.

title: Guy Bradley Visitor Center elevator awaiting repair; 2nd floor access via stairs and steep ramp only
description: The Guy Bradley Visitor Center elevator is broken and awaiting repairs. Access is via stairs and steep outdoor ramp. Park rangers, store, and most exhibits are upstairs. If you can't access 2nd floor and have a question, call (239) 695-2945.

title: Prescribed Fire on Hwy 53 and Zuni-Acoma Trail in April
description: A prescribed fire is planned for late April, exact dates TBD. The prescribed area is adjacent to Hwy 53 between mile markers 71 and 69. During the burn, the west side of the Zuni-Acoma Trail will be closed. More information will be shared when available.

title: Old Mine Road South Closed for Rehabilitation Project
description: Old Mine Road between Millbrook Village and Worthington State Forest will be closed for the 2024 summer season for a pavement rehabilitation project. Please see news releases for more information.
Park Full Name: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area

title: Cave Tours Suspended Beginning May 6, 2024, Through Fall for Elevator Replacement
description: Due to a complete replacement and modernization of our elevator system, tours of Wind Cave will be closed beginning May 6, 2024, and continue into the fall.

title: Loop Road, Campground, and Trails Closed to All Vehicle and Foot Traffic April 15-19
description: The Loop Road, Lava Flow Campground, and all hiking trails are closed to all vehicle and foot traffic for safety reasons while road maintenance takes place. End date is subject to change. This message will be updated as conditions change.
Park Full Name: Craters of the Moon National Monument and Preserve

title: Sections of Sunken Forest Boardwalk Inaccessible During Repair Work
description: During the month of April, a section of boardwalk near Sailors Haven marina will be inaccessible due to repair work. Visitors walking the trail should use the west end trail entrances and walk an out-and-back route, as loop walks will not be possible.

title: Hurricane Ridge Road Status 4/12/24
description: Hurricane Ridge Road is open. Road will remain open unless road conditions prohibit safe travel, conditions are assessed daily.

title: Incoming Calls Issue
description: Incoming callers are experiencing difficulty connecting with the battlefield. If you are trying to contact our team, allow the phone to ring at least 12 times before selecting from the phone tree, or email us at biho_visitor_information@nps.gov.

title: Damaged Bridge on Village Creek
description: The bridge over Village Creek at the junction of the Kirby Nature Trail and Turkey Creek Trail is CLOSED due to flood damage.

title: Phones Down
description: Phone lines at the visitor center are currently not working. Please contact us via email or message us on social media. (Click/tap "more" below.)

title: Construction Closures And Traffic Delays Expected on Generals Highway From Late April to June
description: There will be construction occurring between Hospital Rock and Giant Forest Museum. The work will require periodic closures or traffic delays. For more information, including the expected construction schedule, click the "more" link:

title: Highway 245 is Closed for Construction and Cannot Be Used to Reach or Leave the Grant Grove Area
description: Highway 245 outside the parks is under construction by CalTrans. It is scheduled to be closed through June 30, 2024. It is not possible to reach or leave the Grant Grove area using Highway 245. Alternate routes are available.

title: Park Entrance Sign Closure
description: Starting Monday, April 15, the park entrance sign will be closed due to construction. Please use caution when entering and leaving the park as equipment and workers are nearby.

title: Winter Road Closures
description: The North Rim Road is still closed to cars for the season beyond the gate at the northern park boundary. It is expected to open in early May 2024. The South Rim Drive beyond the visitor center and East Portal Road are open for the season.
Park Full Name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park

title: Increased Traffic on US-80 4/19-4/21
description: Due to event on nearby Tybee Island, traffic may affect entrance to and exit from Fort Pulaski National Monument.

title: Trail and Parking Area Re-Opened - Mt. Alava Trail
description: Mt. Alava trail and parking area are now open to the public. Access to the summit from the Alava Trailhead is strictly prohibited due to serious risks. Death or serious injury can occur. Mt. Alava summit remains accessible from the Old Vatia trail.

title: China Beach parking lot closed for paving on Friday, April 19, 2024
description: As part of an ongoing rehabilitation project, the lot will be closed for asphalt paving the entire day. Beach access will remain open with brief delays to allow construction vehicles to navigate the site.

title: PARK OPEN: Reservation required to drive into or through the park on some dates/times through Oct 27
description: A reservation is required from 5 am to 4 pm on some dates through October 27, 2024. April 13–June 30: weekends and holidays only. July 1–August 16: Daily. August 17– October 27: weekends and holidays only.

title: Natural Bridges is going cashless
description: The park will soon accept only mobile or electronic payments for entrance & camping fees. You can already reserve campsites on Recreation.gov; soon you will be able to buy entrance passes there too or only use debit/credit cards to pay in person.

title: Hovenweep is going cashless
description: The park will soon accept only mobile or electronic payments for entrance & camping fees. You can already reserve campsites on Recreation.gov; soon you will be able to buy entrance passes there too or only use debit/credit cards to pay in person.

title: Headland Trail Closed Across the Cuesta Top.
description: Trail conditions on the Headland Trail have warranted the closure of the trail past Atsina. The trail will remain closed beyond Atsina until conditions improve.

title: Heintooga Round Bottom and Heintooga Ridge roads are closed for the season
description: The following roads are closed for the season: Heintooga Round Bottom and Heintooga Ridge. Both are scheduled to open May 10.

title: Trail Condition Updates
description: Park hiking trails currently have a range of conditions varying from clear and dry to patchy snow, mud and icy spots in the shaded areas. The one-mile Petrified Forest loop is clear. The 1/2 mile Ponderosa Loop is shaded and still has snow and icy spots.

title: Current Park Hours: Visitor Center open Tuesdays to Saturdays; Park Closed Sundays
description: The park is closed Sundays (Visitor Center, main parking lot & nearby trails). The Visitor Center is open Tuesdays through Saturdays, 9am to 4:30pm. On Mondays, the Visitor Center may have reduced hours or remain closed.

title: Winter & Early Spring Hiking Safety
description: During the winter and early spring, if you plan to hike the park trails it is recommended to be prepared with proper footwear, traction devices, and trekking poles. Some areas of the trails can be snow-packed and/or icy and slippery.

title: Phones Temporarily Down
description: Park phones are experiencing technical issues at this time. If unable to reach by phone, please feel free to email cong_information@nps.gov with any questions.

title: Asphalt sealing
description: A rolling closure of Lakeshore parking lots and roads will occur the week of April 15, 2024. Cracks and holes in the asphalt will be sealed ahead of a larger paving project beginning in May.

title: Prescribed fire hotspots near Platte Plains and Good Harbor Bay
description: In early April there were prescribed fires near Bass Lake/Otter Creek and Good Harbor Bay. Please remain on trails. Burned areas that are still producing smoke are likely stump holes, and these can burn quite a distance underground in many directions.

title: Pet Owners: Two sections of Point Reyes Beach are closed to pets through September 30.
description: To better ensure the survival of snowy plover nests and chicks, two sections of Point Reyes Beach are closed to pets through September 30.

title: Some Park Buildings are Temporarily Closed for Maintenance
description: Some Park Buildings are temporarily closed to replace the Fire Suppression Systems. Closed: Dragoon Barracks, Post Headquarters, Quartermaster Storehouse, Visitor Center is in the Infantry Barracks. Follow the link below for a virtual tour of buildings.

title: Reopening of historic Youngsholm on Monday April 15, 2024
description: Charles Young Buffalo Soldiers National Monument is proud to announce the reopening of the historic Young family home on Monday, April 15, 2024, after completing an over two-year $3.1 million dollar restoration. Hours of operation are 9am to 4:30pm, daily
Park Full Name: Charles Young Buffalo Soldiers National Monument

title: Seasonal Canyon Closures
description: The following are closed to the public through 8/31/2024 to protect sensitive resources: the heads of Burro Wash & Fivemile Wash continuing east 2 miles, Shinob Canyon and any route descending into Shinob, including Na-gah, Nighthawk, & Timpie.

title: Construction around Visitor Center
description: There are trail closures in effect around the Visitor Center. Construction has also closed off some parking spaces in the lot. This is the first phase of a major trail rehabilitation project in the park. Call ahead for more information, (336) 288-1776.

title: Hiker Shuttle will not operate April 13 & 14 and April 18-21
description: Due to staffing issues and special events, the shuttle will not operate April 13 & 14 and April 18-21.

title: Scenic Drive Rehabilitation Project
description: This project is expected to begin April 29, 2024. The Scenic Drive will be closed from just south of the campground to Capitol Gorge. Most of the park remains accessible. Note: South Draw Road is unmaintained, not advised, and there is no through access

title: Toxic Cyanobacteria in Halls Creek
description: Toxic cyanobacteria may be present in Halls Creek. Do not submerge your head in or filter drinking water from the creek.

title: Pet Restrictions in Effect March 15 through Labor Day
description: Dogs and other pets are prohibited in the Otis Pike Wilderness and on any of Fire Island's federally-managed oceanfront beaches from March 15 through Labor Day to help protect threatened and endangered beach-nesting shorebirds.

title: Trail Closure
description: Wilderness Road is closed from Tennessee Road Trail to the trail that leads up to Gap Cave for scheduled maintenance work.

title: Temporary closure due to severe weather
description: On April 10, 2024, New Orleans Jazz National Historical Park will be closed due to severe weather. The park will reopen Thursday April 11, 2024, at regular hours.
Park Full Name: New Orleans Jazz National Historical Park

title: Items Worn or Used in Other Caves Not Allowed
description: A disease known as White-Nose Syndrome is killing bats in North America. To prevent it from spreading to our bats, do not wear shoes, clothing, or bring any gear into any cave at Carlsbad Caverns National Park that were in another cave.

title: Going-to-the-Sun Road Seasonal Closure
description: The alpine section of the Going-to-the-Sun Road is closed for the season. Specific closure locations are dependent on plowing progress.

title: Madison Falls Trail Closed for Repairs 4/11-4/17, 4/24-5/1
description: The Madison Falls Trail will be closed for repairs from 4/11 - 4/17 and 4/24 - 5/1. Trail crews will replace failing retaining walls and restore terrain that supports the viewing platform.

title: Potential rabies cases in Saguaro National Park
description: There have been reports of deceased animals and strange wildlife behavior in the area, and rabies was confirmed in one deceased fox in April. If you encounter any abnormal behavior, please contact the park immediately, and use caution around wildlife.

title: Prairie View Trail Closure
description: The Prairie View Trail is currently closed so that crews can restore power transmission lines through Scotts Bluff National Monument. Please respect this closure for the safety of all involved.

title: Portion of Calumet Trail Closed
description: The Calumet Trail from Mineral Springs Road to SR 49 is closed April 15th through the middle of June. There will be no public access through this stretch during this time. The closure is needed to modernize the trail by raising it and paving it.

title: Fayetteville Trail Closure
description: A section of the Fayetteville Trail between Park Loop Trail and the Bridge Trail will be closed from April 15 through April 25 for construction of a new footbridge.
Park Full Name: New River Gorge National Park and Preserve

title: Towpath Trail north of Station Road Bridge Trailhead
description: December 18, 2023 - May 3, 2024, 5 am Mondays through 6 pm Fridays for riverbank stabilization. Open weekends.

title: Cape Point Campground closed due to flooding
description: The Cape Point Campground is currently closed for flooding due to excessive rainfall. Cape Hatteras National Seashore continues to monitor the campground and will reopen it when conditions improve.

title: Summer Campground Stays
description: Due to the many infrastructure projects in the Park this summer, all campgrounds, with the exception of group sites at Grey Cliffs Campground, will operate on a first-come-first-served basis. Arrive early to secure a site. They will sell out quickly.

title: Park Closed on Monday, May 13, 2024
description: The visitor center and all park trails will be closed on Monday, May 13, 2024 for a staff education and training day.

title: Temporary Partial Closure of Smith Road Trailhead Parking Lot April 8 - June 30, 2024
description: Northwest portion of the parking lot off of Bunker Road in Marin Headlands will be temporarily closed. Stay out of the closure and park in the other parking spaces.

title: Passenger Ferry Dock Closed
description: The ferry dock servicing the Cape Lookout Lighthouse area is closed for repairs. Visitors will have to use an alternative route on the beach to access the boardwalk. Visitors should wear sturdy, closed toe shoes because of potential hazards.

title: Park Visitor Center only open on two days for the next two weeks.
description: Until Sunday April 21st, the Sitka National Historical Park Visitor Center will only be open on Monday, April 8th and Monday, April 15th, 10am until 4pm as we prepare our spaces and staff for the busy 2024 summer visitation season.

title: Lassen National Park Highway is CLOSED for the season
description: Lassen National Park Highway connecting the north and south park entrances is CLOSED to vehicles. Vehicles can still access two park entrances. One at the northwest and the other at the southwest entrances throughout the snow season. Learn more.

title: Tree Pruning at Scorpion Campground during April
description: During April 2024, safety-related tree pruning work is scheduled to occur Monday-Thursday 8am to 5pm at the Scorpion Campground. For your safety, staff may need to relocate campsites if the workers need to access the trees in your reserved campsite.

title: Road maintenance on Bald Hills (after Dolason trailhead).
description: From April 15-June 2024, the Humboldt County Department of Public Works will be resurfacing Bald Hills Road from post mark 16.05 to 19.04. Expect delays greater than 15 minutes. For concerns or questions, contact Angi Sorensen at (707) 445-7448.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Road maintenance on Bald Hills (after Dolason trailhead).', 'id': '714A6CE6-A089-4373-A5BB-0077816C36FE', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/redw/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: Visitor Center Open Monday, April 8, 2024 for Eclipse Activities
description: Memorial Visitor Center open from 9:00 am to 3:00 pm. Limited parking at the park. Overflow at Heritage Hills High School. Shuttle service provided.

title: Temporary Closure of southwestern end of Drakes Beach due to the presence of elephant seals.
description: Until further notice, Drakes Beach is closed to all entry west (i.e., to the right when facing Drakes Bay) of the Kenneth C. Patrick Visitor Center to the year-round closure area at the southwest end of Drakes Beach.

title: State Route 148 has closed for the winter season
description: Visitors can still easily access the park via Highway 143 and the town of Brian Head. You can view Cedar Breaks from the Northview Overlook. State Route 143 (connecting Parowan to Panguitch) will remain open, weather permitting.

title: Timed Entry Ticket Required to Enter Carlsbad Cavern
description: Reservations are highly recommended and can be purchased by clicking "more" or calling 877-444-6777. Reservations only select the entry time. Upon arrival at the visitor center, an entrance pass must be purchased.

title: Backcountry and Trail Closures Due to Flood Damage
description: The following areas & trails are closed: Guadalupe Ridge (visitor center to Slaughter Canyon Trail), Rattlesnake Canyon, & Juniper Ridge. Click "More" for information about trails that are open.

title: Walnut Canyon Desert Drive Closed Due to Flood Damage
description: Recent flooding has caused major damage to the road. It is unknown when repairs will begin or the length of time to complete. The main park road to the visitor center and cavern is open. For updates on the road and trails, click "More" below.

title: Lower Segment of Tennessee Valley Trail Temporarily Closed Until Further Notice
description: Following an assessment from the park's maintenance team, the trail segment going to the beach and beach are closed for visitor safety. See link for more information about the trail and safety closure.

title: Pierce Stocking Scenic Drive Winter & Spring Road Closure
description: The scenic drive is closed. It is open to foot traffic until it reopens to vehicles. The drive opens to vehicles a few weeks after all threat of snow and ice have passed, usually late April or early May.

title: Some Winter Seasonal Road Closures Remain In Effect
description: It is still winter in the mountains, and some roads remain under a seasonal closure. To see which roads are closed, click on the "more" link:

title: Hart Mine Closed due to dangerous potential for collapse
description: Hart Mine Road is missing several wooden culverts the burned in the 2023 York Fire. THe road may appear intact but could cave in under the weight of a vehicle. Stay off Hart Mine Road for your safety.

title: Huffman Prairie Flying Field Interpretive Center Closed 4/9 - 7/31
description: The Huffman Prairie Flying Field Interpretive Center will open for the total eclipse on April 8, and then close. While the interior park facilities will be closed, the grounds of the Wright Memorial and the Huffman Prairie Flying Field will remain open.
Park Full Name: Dayton Aviation Heritage National Historical Park

title: Temporary Closure for Nesting Raptors
description: Due to the presence of nesting raptors, the following rock climbing areas are temporarily closed: Slatanic Area, Rattlesnake Buttress, Margaret Thatcher Spire, The Stepping Stones, The Bulkhead, The Dunce Cap, and Commissioner’s Buttress.

title: Tonto National Monument Temporarily Closed on Wednesdays and Thursdays
description: Tonto National Monument will temporarily change its hours of operations. Starting on April 17, Tonto National Monument will be closed on Wednesdays and Thursdays. These hours will stay in effect until further notice.

title: Wall Street side of Navajo Loop Closed
description: The Wall St. side of Navajo Loop is expected to remain closed until Memorial Day weekend due to rockfall hazard and trail damage. The Two Bridges side of the loop remains open.

title: Trail Closure
description: The portion of the Historic Battlefield Trail located on the southwest corner of the park will be closed beginning Monday, April 8, 2024, for construction. The closure is expected to last until the end of June.
Park Full Name: Palo Alto Battlefield National Historical Park

title: Three lane configuration between Windy Run Bridge and Beltway on North Parkway
description: The National Park Service has implemented a temporary traffic pattern on George Washington Memorial Parkway between I-495 and Windy Run Bridge as part of the North Parkway Rehabilitation Project.

title: Great Falls Visitor Center Closed for Construction
description: The Visitor Center at Great Falls Park is temporarily closed for construction, but the restrooms remain open 9:30 - 5:30, and overlooks and trails remain open.

title: Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures
description: Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.

title: Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures
description: Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.

title: Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures
description: Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.

title: Spring Conditions
description: Spring weather is variable at Mesa Verde. Snow and ice can delay opening the main park road. Trails often become muddy or closed due to rain or late snow melt. Current info is available at the Visitor and Resource Center. Click the link below for update

title: Closures on parts of Garden Key and Loggerhead Key
description: Garden Key finger piers are closed until further notice, but the dinghy beach between the main dock and the seaplane beach is open. On Loggerhead Key, the Historic Preservation/Adaptive Use zone around the lighthouse is closed.

title: Visitor Center Closed Mondays and Tuesdays
description: The Visitor Center at George Washington Birthplace National Monument is closed on Mondays and Tuesdays. Park grounds are open daily 9:00 - 5:00 pm. On Mondays and Tuesdays, there are no ranger guided tours.

title: Swift Brook Road Gates Closed for Mud Season
description: As of March 4, 2024, the gates on Swift Brook Road that are managed by Prentiss & Carlisle have been closed and locked. These privately owned roads are closed to vehicle traffic every spring during "mud season" to prevent road damage.
Park Name: Katahdin Woods And Waters National Monument
Park Full Name: Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument
Type of Unit: Katahdin Woods And Waters National Monument

title: 8 Miles of Unpaved Road to Reach Park
description: In order to reach the Sand Creek Massacre NHS, you must travel on at least 8 miles of unpaved roads. We are not able to guarantee road conditions of county roads 54 or W after spring storms.
Park Full Name: Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site

title: Abó Visitor Center and Restrooms Closed April 23, 24, 27, 28
description: Due to staffing logistics, the Abó visitor center and restrooms will be closed on 4/23, 24, 27 and 28. The trails will remain open from 9 am - 4 pm. Restrooms are available at the headquarters visitor center. For questions, call HQ at 505-847-2585.

title: Tioga Road, Glacier Point Road, and Mariposa Grove Road are closed for the winter
description: Tioga Road (continuation of Highway 120 through the park) and Glacier Point Road are closed for the season due to snow. They usually open in late May or June. Call 209/372-0200 (then 1, 1) for road conditions and tire chain requirements.

title: Main Road Status
description: The main park road is fully open to Rainbow Point (Mile 18 of 18). All park roads are currently open for the season. During snowstorms the road may temporarily close at Mile 3 for snowplow operations.

title: Active Bee Season
description: Please use caution and be aware of your surroundings when visiting the park due to possible encounters with active beehives this season.
Park Full Name: San Antonio Missions National Historical Park

title: Ramp Closed at the Ribault Column
description: The Ribault Column ramp is closed for repairs. This project includes replacement of deck boards, top rails and other minor maintenance items. This project will take about 4 weeks. During this project the stairs will remain open.

title: Construction Under Way on Site
description: Watch your step and be aware of open excavations. Stop, look, and listen for trucks. Avoid moving equipment and stay clear of work areas. Parents, please warn children about the dangers present onsite. Safety first!

title: 111th Street Bridge to I-94 Closed for Construction
description: A full closure of the 111th St. bridge to I-94 is required for repairs. Motorists should follow the posted detour starting April 1.

title: April 21, 2024: Summer Hours Begin
description: Effective Sunday, April 21, Steamtown NHS will be open daily, from 9:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.

title: Resurfacing Rim Rock Drive
description: Project work runs from 4/2- 8/5. There will be delays of up to 15 minutes and occasional road closures between DS Rd and Independence Monument View. Visit the project page for a full work schedule.

title: Cave Tours are Back!
description: The 2024 season has begun! Demand during spring break is high. Early sellouts are common. Be sure to call ahead for current conditions before driving and walking 60-minutes to the visitor center. 541-592-5125.
Park Full Name: Oregon Caves National Monument and Preserve

title: Temporary Closure at Machete Ridge
description: The area within the following boundary is closed to public access for the protection of wildlife: The southern portion of the Machete Ridge rock formation and access trails are closed to climbing and off-trail hiking. Please review the closure posting.

title: Cave Tour Reservations Are Strongly Recommended - Walkup Tickets Are Not Guaranteed
description: Advance cave tour reservations are available on recreation.gov through May 31st. Reservations for June will become available early May. The reservations close at noon the day before. Reservations are the best way to ensure tickets for your group.

title: Road Construction Update - Delays and Closures Start April 2024
description: Phase one of this major road improvement project starts April 1, 2024 with alternating one-way traffic (15-minute stops/delays) starting at the park entrance on Hwy 347. Tomichi Point parking lot and viewpoint will be closed for the month of April.
Park Full Name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park

title: Road Construction at Black Canyon South Rim - 2024 and 2025
description: Major road improvement projects will impact the park from April-November 2024. Expect delays, alternating one-way traffic, and parking lot closures from the park boundary on Hwy 347 to the visitor center. Drive with extra caution. More road work in 2025.
Park Full Name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park

title: Bayside Day Use Area Temporary Closure
description: The Bayside Parking Area, Bayside Beach and Bayside Picnic Area will be closed for construction beginning Monday April 1st. This area will be Closed to all Visitors until work is completed.

title: Cima Road between Cima and Interstate 15 CLOSED Until Late June 2024
description: Cima Road between Kelso Cima Road in Cima and Interstate 15 along the north preserve boundary is CLOSED to all vehicles. Please do not drive around barricades, or cross this active construction zone in the Cima Dome area.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Cima Road Closed to ALL VEHICLES due to Construction', 'id': '734DA552-488D-4A3F-979D-751E95AB05CA', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/moja/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail Closure through Scotts Run Nature Preserve
description: Scotts Run Nature Preserve will be temporarily closed during the repair of wastewater pipes to maintain the safety of the public and to preserve the natural resources throughout the site.

title: High Visitation during the months of March, April, and May
description: Spring is upon us, we expect high visitation at Saguaro National Park during March, April, & May. There is limited parking at the Rincon Mountain Visitor Center (east side). Large vehicles may find difficulty parking on the east side. Call for more info.

title: Periodic Closures of Signal Hill Picnic Area (Tucson Mountain District)
description: Periodic closures of the Signal Hill Picnic Area will be in effect through May 2024 to allow for the completion of a major repair and improvement project. Please click this link for further information and a calendar of upcoming closures.

title: Visitor Center building closed; Passes available at Entrance Gate, trails & overlooks Open
description: The Great Falls Visitor Center building is temporarily closed until further notice for needed construction projects. Overlooks & Trails OPEN. Park closed at dark 7:30 pm.

title: Abó Visitor Center and Restrooms Closed April 15, 16, 17, 21
description: Due to staffing logistics, the Abó visitor center and restrooms will be closed on 4/15,16,17, and 21. The trails will remain open from 9 am - 4 pm. Restrooms are available at the headquarters visitor center. For questions, call hq at 505-847-2585.

title: Limited Access to Second Floor of JFK Birthplace Begins 2/13
description: Beginning February 13, the nursery and bathroom on the second floor of the house will be undergoing restoration work. This work will be ongoing. Until it is complete, there will be limited or no access to the second floor for reserved off season tours.
Park Full Name: John Fitzgerald Kennedy National Historic Site

title: Exhibit Change
description: Exhibit space will be under construction on 4/25 & 4/26 as we change from "Beyond Camelot" to "Leaders in Literacy." The Education Center will remain open during this time and Saxton House tour will still leave from the Education Center.

title: Casa Grande Ruins Picnic Area is closed through April 30, 2024
description: Casa Grande Ruins picnic area is closed March 28 - April 30, 2024, due to the density of an invasive and noxious weed called Stinknet, which can cause skin rashes and serious breathing problems. The park is working to open it back up as soon as possible.

title: Road Construction Delays April 1 to Mid-August 2024
description: Road construction in the park from April 1 to mid-August 2024. Weekly updates on construction activities and locations in the park will be posted on the Bighorn Canyon Facebook page. Visitors can also call 307-548-5406 for current conditions.

title: Birth Home Temporarily Closed For Repairs
description: The birth home of Martin Luther King, Jr. is temporarily closed for repairs. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. All other buildings at the Martin Luther King, Jr. National Historical Park remain open during regular park operating hours.
Park Full Name: Martin Luther King, Jr., National Historical Park

title: Mansion ADA Inclined platform lift not functional as of March 27, 2024
description: Mansion ADA Inclined platform lift not functional as of March 27, 2024. Until further notice the Mansion tour is not ADA accessible. We apologize for any inconvenience.

title: Tours By Appointment Unavailable on Set Dates in April and May 2024
description: Due to pre-existing educational programming and training, off season tours by appointment are unavailable on the following dates: April - 4/8, 4/10, 4/12, and 4/15; May - 5/20 through 5/31
Park Full Name: John Fitzgerald Kennedy National Historic Site

title: Jordan Pond Road closed due to bridge repair project
description: Jordan Pond Road is closed to through traffic as part of a bridge repair project. Stanley Brook Road will remain open to provide access the Jordan Pond area.

title: High Visitation: limited EV charging, busy parking lots
description: Expect congestion in popular areas such as visitor centers and points of interest due to Spring Break. There is EXTREMELY limited EV charging in the park; consider charging in nearby Beatty, NV or other locations before arrival. Please drive with caution.

title: Western Gulls Nesting on Anacapa Island From April Through Mid-August
description: During this time, visitors will encounter seabird rookery conditions: feces, strong odor, constant noise, bird carcasses, and birds protecting their territory. If visitors consider these conditions adverse, it is advised that they visit another island.

title: Hiking in Gold Mine Tract
description: Visitors are restricted to the designated trails within the Gold Mine Tract in the Great Falls area. This location is generally defined as that area bordered by MacArthur Boulevard and Berma Road and depicted on the Great Falls Maryland Hiking Map.
Park Full Name: Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park

title: Sandy Hook Season Beach Passes available April 16 on recreation.gov.
description: Sandy Hook Season Beach Passes will go on sale April 16 at 10 am through Recreation.gov

title: No Water at Rough Canyon
description: The water at Rough Canyon is not operational, so there are no fish cleaning station, potable water, or restroom. There are portable outhouses. Bring drinking or cooking water when visiting / camping in the area; 1 gallon per person per day is recommended.

title: Buxton Beach Access & Adjacent Beach Temporarily Closed
description: The Buxton Beach Access, located at the end of Old Lighthouse Road in Buxton, and an adjacent three-tenths of a mile long stretch of beach, are temporarily closed due to petroleum contamination and remnant military infrastructure.

title: Closure of Campsites in Park Campgrounds
description: Due to infrastructure improvements this summer, Turkey Run Group Campground is closed 10-1-23 thru 4-30-24, Cabin Camp 3 is closed until 4-30-24, and Campsite A1-A24, A31-A42, and B1-B7 in Oak Ridge Campground will be closed from 12-12-23 thru 4-25-24.

title: Prince William Forest RV Campground will be closed until the end of April 2024
description: Due to delay in infrastructure improvements, the concession operated RV campground off of Hwy 234 will now be closed until April 30, 2024.

title: Manzanar Visitor Center Hours
description: The visitor center at Manzanar National Historic Site is open four days a week, Friday through Monday, 9AM to 4:30PM. The visitor center will be closed Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. Block 14 and the grounds remain open daily.

title: Maurice Stephens Parking Lot Closed During Construction Project
description: The parking lot near the Maurice Stephens house, located on Rt 23 opposite from the Washington Memorial Chapel, is closed during construction and renovation work on the house. Visitors are encouraged to park in the Chapel lot for Grand Parade trail access

title: Help Prevent Aquatic Invasive Species (AIS) Infestation
description: A number of lakes are infested with an array of aquatic invasive species that damage natural ecosystems and waterways. Boaters are advised to Clean, Drain, and Dry all boats and equipment every time they leave the water. Click "more" to learn about AIS.

title: Gulf Coast canoe/kayak launch and visitor center close on April 1 for construction
description: Alternate launch sites for backcountry access include the Rod & Gun Club, Outdoor Resorts of Chokoloskee, and Chokoloskee Island Park and Marina. Fees at these sites vary. Call the Gulf Coast Contact Station at 239-232-0057 for more information.

title: Temporary Schedule Change - Open Wednesday Through Sunday
description: As of March 25th, we are temporarily moving to a Wednesday through Sunday schedule while we bring on new staff during this Spring season. We plan to be back to a full 7-day per week schedule by May 5th. We apologize for any inconvenience.
Park Name: Rosie the Riveter WWII Home Front
Park Full Name: Rosie the Riveter/World War II Home Front National Historical Park

title: Hiker Shuttle Service Suspended April 18 & 19
description: Due to a special event, the 9 am hiker shuttle will not operate Thursday, April 18 and Friday, April 19. Additional shuttles will be provided Saturday, April 20.

title: Faraway Ranch Parking Lot Closed April 17-19
description: Due to a special event, only vehicles with disability plates or placards will be allowed to park at Faraway Ranch from 3 pm on Wednesday, April 17 to 6 pm on Friday, April 19.

title: No Oversized Vehicles, Stock, or Horses April 17-20
description: Due to a special event, no vehicles beyond 24 feet, trailers, horses or stock use are allowed in the park from 3 pm on Wednesday, April 17 to 6 pm on Saturday, April 20. Exception: Vehicles with reservations at the campground may proceed directly to site.

title: Transition to Summer Schedule
description: The Andrew Johnson NHS will transition to summer hours on Sunday, April 7th, 2024. At this time the park will resume a 7-day a week operation from 9:00 am - 4:00 pm daily.

title: Service Road Closure
description: The Service Road/Trail from the Lighthouse parking lot toward the lighthouse and the road between the fort and visitor center hills are closed to due scheduled construction of the roadway. Please do not enter the area.

title: Fire Ban in Effect
description: San Juan Island National Historical Park is placed under a fire ban.
Park Full Name: San Juan Island National Historical Park

title: Closure of Paul H. Douglas Center for Environmental Education
description: Due to the construction of a new bridge over Lake St., the Douglas Center will be temporarily closed on weekdays approximately 3-4 weeks, and intermittently through July 2024. A smaller portion of the parking lot and trails are still open every day.

title: Spruce Railroad Trail Closure
description: A temporary steel plate has been installed at the Daley-Rankin Tunnel and pedestrian bridge on the Spruce Railroad Trail and the trail is fully open. Once a permanent steel plate is delivered, the trail will close for 1-2 days for installation.

title: Weekend Guided Tours Availability
description: Please visit the Guided Tours of the Taft Family Home page to review the tour times available for visitors on weekend day visits.
Park Full Name: William Howard Taft National Historic Site

title: No Visitor Center
description: Currently, there is no visitor center for Amache National Historic Site. There is a museum in the town of Granada that is operated by Amache Preservation Society. Learn more at amache.org

title: Winter Seasonal Road Closures
description: Portions of the Teton Park Road (Taggart Lake TH to Signal Mt.), Moose-Wilson Road (Granite Canyon TH to Death Canyon Road), and other roads are closed to vehicles. Check the Grand Teton Roads page for the latest seasonal and weather related closures.

title: New Tour Times
description: Contact the Visitor Center at 505-757-7241 to confirm tour and ranger-led program availability.

title: Spring Schedule
description: Park Rangers are available 9:00AM-4:30PM Wednesday-Friday. Guided walking tours at 2PM. Park ranger availability and 2PM tours are provided on weekends as staffing permits. Please call 973-523-0370 the day of your visit to ensure availability.
Park Full Name: Paterson Great Falls National Historical Park

title: Shiloh Visitor Center Closure
description: UPDATE - The Shiloh visitor center museum remains closed for exhibit installation. The Shiloh film is being shown in the visitor center auditorium. Please enter through marked side door facing parking area.

title: Steel Creek Ranger Station Open - Limited Hours
description: The Steel Creek Ranger Station is open for limited hours from Fri-Sun. If you arrive and the building is closed, please call or visit the Tyler Bend Visitor Center for Park information.

title: Park Buildings Temporarily Closed on Wednesdays & Thursdays
description: This closure only effects park buildings and programing, the grounds are still open daily from 1/2 hour before sunrise until 1/2 hour after sunset. To visit the site virtually, follow the link at the bottom.

title: U.S. Highway 50 Roadwork (On hold until Spring 2024)
description: Road construction with delays and nightly closures on US Highway 50 between Cimarron and Pine Creek continues at least through Summer 2024. The road is open to two-way traffic on weekends and holidays. Cycling is not permitted through the project.

title: Boardwalks at Carrington House and Watch Hill Closed
description: Due to recent storm damage, boardwalks at the Carrington House and Watch Hill Nature Trail are closed until further notice.

title: Park contact stations (visitor centers and ranger stations) closed in winter October thru April.
description: The national park and preserve public lands are open year-round, with limited access in winter. Visitor centers are open in summer but closed for winter. Call (907) 822-7250 or email wrst_info@nps.gov for park information.

title: Summer 2024 visitor contact station days and hours of operation.
description: HQ Visitor Center 5/13-9/15 daily 9-5; Slana Ranger Station 5/24-9/21 daily 9-5; Chitina Ranger Station 5/24-8/31 Fridays and Saturdays only 9-5; Kennecott Visitor Center 5/24-9/6 daily - hours vary. Call 907-822-7250 for more information.

title: Visitor Center Work in Progress
description: The park's visitor center is getting some much need upgrades to its heating, venting, and air conditioning system. The work is expected to last into early 2024. The work may intermittently prohibit use of the visitor center's theater.
Park Full Name: San Antonio Missions National Historical Park

title: Operations Schedule
description: Effective December 3, 2023, the park grounds and restrooms will be open daily from 9:00 am - 5:00 pm. The Visitor Center will be open Wednesday through Sunday from 10:00 am - 4:00 pm.

title: Infrastructure Projects in 2024 may impede access
description: Due to major infrastructure projects occurring in the park this year, intermittent traffic disruptions, campground closures, and parking impacts will be visible through the busy season. Call 775-234-7331 for most current information.

title: Annual Temporary Closure of Presidio Trust Managed Trails for Coyote Breeding Season
description: To reduce the potential for coyote/dog conflict, Presidio Trust has proactively closed large sections of the Park Trail and the Bay Area Ridge Trail to dog walking. Trails will reopen to dog walking in fall after pupping season ends. See link for more.

title: Delta-01 Tours Modified
description: Due to mechanical issues and repairs, Delta-01 tours will be modified and only include the topside and will not go underground to the Launch Control Center. Instead, there will be a virtual tour of the underground.

title: No Drinking Water at Dante Fascell Visitor Center
description: Beginning on March 13, 2024 for approximately two weeks drinking water will be unavailable at the Dante Fascell Visitor Center during a construction project. During this time visitors are asked to bring as much water as they will need for their visit.

title: South Parking Lot construction starting Monday, March 18
description: Construction on the South Parking Lot is scheduled to begin on Monday, March 18, 2024. Construction is expected to last roughly 3 weeks weather permitting. There will be intermittent closures, so please follow all signs and instructions.

title: Horse Trail Closed
description: The Horse Trail remains closed due to excessively wet ground conditions. A decision on the timeframe for reopening the trail will be made in the spring of 2024.

title: BOARDWALK CLOSED along the River Trail
description: Due to structural issues, the boardwalk along the river trail is closed until further notice. Access to the Ocmulgee Heritage Trail and river is not available due to this closure. This closure does not affect access to any of the mound sites.

title: High Levels of Visitation Warning
description: Due to spring break expect high levels of visitation from the months of March through May. Expect limited parking, long lines, and crowded areas. Please have your form of payment ready or park pass with ID when checking in.

title: Montezuma Castle and Montezuma Well Closed To RV's/Trailers
description: Due to high levels of visitation expected and limited parking; from 10am-2pm parking for oversized vehicles will not be permitted. This means RV's, trailers, buses, or any vehicle that takes up more than one parking space. Drop off at flagpole is allowed.

title: Be Aware of Your Surroundings
description: Ongoing investigation of an aggravated assault between Nolands Ferry and Point of Rocks parking areas. Let others know your itinerary, walk with a buddy, and be aware of your surroundings. Submit a tip: 888-653-0009, nps_isb@nps.gov, go.nps.gov/SubmitATip
Park Full Name: Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park

title: Inaccurate Third-Party Apps
description: Some third-party hiking apps are providing inaccurate trail and safety information to users. Please use the official NPS app for accurate information.

title: East and West Auto Tour Closed
description: Due to recent weather events the East Auto Tour has been temporarily closed. The West Auto Tour is closed for the season.

title: Rim Drive and North Entrance Road are CLOSED for the Season
description: The roads will not reopen until sometime in June or July as plow operators are gradually able to clear sections of large quantities of snow. All other roads remain OPEN, *weather permitting.* Expect snowy and icy conditions. All Oregon chain laws apply.

title: Summer Operating Hours
description: Beginning Sunday March 10th, the park will begin operating on the summer hours of 6:00 AM - 8:00 PM.

title: Park grounds hours change Sunday 10 March
description: Beginning March 10, park grounds will be open 8 am to 7 pm. The Western Avenue entrance gate to Jockey Hollow will close at approximately 6:30 pm.

title: Credit/Debit Card only for park entrance fees
description: Starting May 1, 2023, Prince William Forest Park will no longer accept cash for park entrance fees. Entrance fees and passes can be purchased with credit/debit card at the park or online through recreation.gov.

title: Harbor Seal Pupping Season Closures are in effect from March 1 through June 30.
description: From March 1 through June 30, the park implements closures of Drakes Estero, Double Point, & the western end of Limantour Spit to protect harbor seals during the pupping season. Please avoid disturbing seals to ensure a successful pupping season.

title: The Island Loop Drive on Jamestown Island closed to vehicular traffic beginning Monday, March 18
description: The Island Loop Drive on Jamestown Island at Colonial National Historical Park will be closed fully to vehicular traffic beginning Monday, March 18 to protect turtles during periods of increased activity and conduct a turtle activity study.

title: Seasonal closure of certain areas to prevent poaching
description: The floodplain forest between the Connecticut River and NH Route 12A, north of the Blow-Me-Down Brook and forested areas on either side of Saint-Gaudens Road are closed to prevent damage from fiddlehead poaching during the months of April and May.

title: The Island Loop Drive on Jamestown Island closed to vehicular traffic beginning Monday, March 18
description: The Island Loop Drive on Jamestown Island at Colonial National Historical Park will be closed fully to vehicular traffic beginning Monday, March 18 to protect turtles during periods of increased activity and conduct a turtle activity study.

title: Ivanpah Road Repairs - Traffic Subject to minor delays
description: Mojave National Preserve Road Crews will be repairing a problematic low water crossing ~2 miles north of the Junction of Cedar Canyon Road. Minor Delays are expected.

title: English Camp Visitor Center closed.
description: The English Camp Visitor Center is closed for the season. It will reopen in May.
Park Full Name: San Juan Island National Historical Park

title: Evening Closures in May
description: The main entrance of the park as well as Bannister Bridge Canoe Launch will close at 4:30 PM daily May 16-25. All visitors will need to exit before 4:30 PM. Campgrounds will be closed during this time, and no backcountry camping permits will be issued.

title: Very limited parking at China Beach (through early 2024)
description: A majority of the parking lot will be closed as a multi-phase project kicks off. Access to the beach will remain open. The first phase is expect to complete early 2024. See link for more.

title: Main Park Roads Open to Vehicular Traffic Starting March 10
description: Beginning Sunday, March 10th, 2024, main park roads will be open to vehicular traffic from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.

title: Ocean Beach Fire Season in Effect through October 31, 2024
description: Fires allowed ONLY in provided fire rings between Stairwells 15 and 20. For more information, check the link below.

title: Generators Permitted in Loop C Only
description: Generators are only permitted in Loop C of the Fruita Campground. Generator use hours limits are still in effect.

title: 2024 Permits Now on Sale Through Recreation.Gov
description: Fishing Access, FBF Archery, GKP Boat Ramp permits available for purchase ONLINE ONLY through RECREATION.GOV from March 1- April 30 ONLY.

title: High Levels of Visitation
description: Due to spring break expect high levels of visitation through the months of March through May. Expect limited parking, long lines, and have your pass or form of payment ready when checking in.

title: Pilgrim Heights Parking Area and Access Closed 3/11-4/20
description: Between 3/11-4/20, the Pilgrim Heights parking area and access roadways in Truro will be temporarily closed to allow for repaving and survey work. 24-hour vehicle and pedestrian closures will be in place during this time.

title: Winter High Water Warning - Lifejackets Mandatory
description: The Delaware River is measuring above 8 feet at the Montague Gauge. Lifejackets are mandatory for boaters from November 1st until April 30th due to risk of cold-water shock. River accesses will be closed if the river reaches 15 feet or hazards arise.
Park Full Name: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area

title: River Ferry at Akers (on State Highway K) CLOSED until further notice
description: The Akers Ferry on State Highway K will not be in service until further notice.

title: Kīlauea volcano is not erupting
description: The eruption that began on September 10, 2023 has ended. No lava fountains, flows, or night glow is visible at this time.

title: Condition of Turkey Creek Trail
description: Turkey Creek Trail, located near the Harbor Bay Campground Area, is currently underwater in some parts. We are working on this issue. An alternative hiking trail would be Harbor Bay Trail.

title: Prepare for Crowds and Heavy Traffic
description: March and April are our two busiest months. Expect limited parking, full campgrounds, and long lines at entrances. Parking lots and trailheads may temporarily close due to traffic congestion. For our best trip-planning advice, click the link below.

title: Watch Out for Tortoises on the Road
description: Desert tortoises are active in the spring and will sometimes cross the road. Please drive cautiously and obey the speed limit. To learn more about this iconic species, why they are threatened today, and what to do if you see one, click the link below.

title: 'Lake Manly' closed to boating
description: Water levels dropped at Badwater. It is not possible to get to the water without leaving extensive social trails through the mud that will be visible until the next time the lake refills. Lake Manly is now closed to boating.

title: Moores Creek Visitor Center Open Tuesday-Saturday and Park Grounds Open Seven Days Per Week
description: The Moores Creek Visitor Center/Bookstore is open Tuesday to Saturday from 9 am until 5 pm. Park grounds are open seven days per week from 9 am until 5 pm.

title: Hart Mine Road CLOSED due to collapsed culverts
description: Do not drive on Hart Mine Road. Missing culverts are hazardous for all vehicles and road is subject to sudden collapse. Please do not drive around signed barricades.

title: Most of Bandelier Remains Open, Tsankawi Unit Closed
description: Bandelier National Monument's Tsankawi Unit is closed due to extensive construction work. It is expected to reopen before the Summer 2024 season.

title: Memorial House Museum and Colonial Revival Kitchen Closed for Restoration Work.
description: The Memorial House Museum and Colonial Revival Kitchen are closed for restoration work, with an anticipated completion in Spring 2024.

title: Military History Museum is Closed, but Bunker will be open on Saturday
description: The Military History Museum is closed due to an electrical issue. However, the Military Bunker will still be open on Saturday for visitors.

title: All Trailers Must Disconnect at Faraway Ranch Parking Lot
description: All trailers MUST be disconnected and parked at Faraway Ranch parking lot unless proceeding directly to a reserved campsite.

title: Old Indian Trail Area Closure
description: An area surrounding and including the Old Indian Trail system is closed. An infestation of Hemlock Wolly Adelgid (HWA) has been identified in the area. HWA is an exotic invasive insect that can rapidly defoliate and kill hemlock trees.

title: Santa Barbara Island Temporary Closure
description: Santa Barbara Island is temporarily closed to all public entry to protect breeding populations of California brown pelicans. The closure will continue until the end of the breeding season.

title: Wet Creek Crossing at Canada Del Puerto, Prisoner's Harbor
description: During winter and spring, visitors need to be prepared for a wet creek crossing at Canada del Puerto in Prisoner's Harbor. Water may be fast moving and over 3 feet deep after heavy rain.

title: George Rogers Clark NHP in the Eastern Time Zone
description: George Rogers Clark National Historical Park is located in the Eastern Time Zone. The park is open 9:00 am until 5:00 pm (Eastern time). The memorial closes 15 minutes before the visitor center.
Park Full Name: George Rogers Clark National Historical Park

title: Cape Hatteras Lighthouse Closed for Restoration- Other facilities Open
description: The Cape Hatteras Light Station is currently undergoing a large restoration project. The Lighthouse is closed to climbing, but the Museum of the Sea and Park Store remain open.

title: Changing conditions
description: Inclement weather may cause unexpected delays, closures and possibly hazardous road conditions. The visitor center phone line may be unavailable.

title: Cascade River Road Closed for the Winter Season
description: Cascade River Road is closed for the winter season at milepost 20 (El Dorado parking lot), three miles before the trailhead.

title: Equestrian Traffic Temporarily Prohibited Milepost 156-173
description: Horses are prohibited between Paw Paw Tunnel (mile 156) and Spring Gap (mile 173) due to recent and ongoing towpath resurfacing. See more for details.
Park Full Name: Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park

title: Phones Down at the Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site
description: For any general inquiries, visitors can contact Ranger Myia Patterson at (334)421-0340 For reservations to visit the Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site, please call Ranger Sheryl Buchanan at (334)421-3246

title: Seasonal climbing closures in effect
description: All climbers should ensure routes are not subject to wildlife seasonal closures. Many closures start March 1, March 15, or April 1 and continue through spring and summer.

title: Seasonal climbing closures in effect
description: All climbers should ensure routes are not subject to wildlife seasonal closures. Many closures start March 1 or April 1 and continue through spring and summer.

title: Timed Entry Reservation Pilot 2024
description: To enter the park from April 1 to October 31, 2024, visitors will need a Timed Entry Ticket. Tickets may be purchased from Recreation.gov up to three months prior to visiting. Extra tickets will become available at 7pm for night-before purchase.

title: The restrooms at Cottonwood Visitor Center are temporarily closed.
description: There are portable toilets available for use in the parking lot. Visitors are also welcome to use the flush toilets at Cottonwood Campground.

title: Restroom Closure
description: Flight 93 National Memorial permanent restroom facilities are closed due to construction. Temporary restroom facilities are available outside of the Visitor Center and at the Memorial Plaza.

title: Short Term Construction
description: Construction will begin the week of February 26, 2024, along Flight Path at the Visitor Center. The Visitor Center remains open. We apologize for the short-term inconvenience.

title: Maintenance on Scott's Run and Wilderness Run Bridges Starting March 1, 2024
description: Between March and June, ongoing maintenance work on the Scott's Run bridges (on the Chancellorsville Battlefield on Stuart Drive) and the Wilderness Run bridge (on Hill-Ewell Drive on the Wilderness Battlefield) may cause some detours and delay.
Park Full Name: Fredericksburg and Spotsylvania County Battlefields Memorial National Military Park

title: Vehicle Length Limits
description: Vehicles longer than 24 feet are not permitted past the visitor center on Bonita Canyon Drive. Vehicles up to 29 feet are still allowed to stay in the campground, but can't go further. Parking for large vehicles and trailers is available at Faraway Ranch.

title: South Woolum Road Closed, Alternate Route Available
description: In the interest of safety, the South Woolum Road has been closed. The Woolum launch and campground remain open.

title: Morristown road closures beginning 29 February
description: On 2/29 Eastbound Morris St. will be closed down to one lane starting at Ridgedale Ave for about 140 days. Westbound Morris St will closed to all traffic starting at the intersection of Ford Ave and Taft Lane. Please plan alternate routes.

title: Application for Special Use Permit
description: Beginning March 1, 2024, each applicant will be required to complete a new "Application For Special Use Permit" prior to any new permit being issued

title: Temporary Closure on Santa Rosa Island
description: The beaches and dunes of China Camp and Cluster Point, and area in-between, are temporarily closed to all visitor access for the protection of sensitive resources. Travel is allowed on marked paths.

title: Mount Locust Grounds Open intermittently
description: Due to storm damage the visitor center and restrooms are closed. The grounds, and historic inn and stand will be open intermittently throughout the winter.

title: Crater Lake National Park is a Snow Zone
description: Expect snowy and icy conditions when driving and walking. All Oregon Chain Laws apply.

title: U.S. side of Chilkoot National Historic Trail to Open as far as Mile 4 for the 2024 Season
description: No public access on the U.S. side of the Chilkoot Trail past mile 4.0 on the Chilkoot Trail for the 2024 season. Permitted overnight camping is only for the Canadian side of the Trail – the Reservation Line will be open starting March 27 (1-800-661-0486).
Park Full Name: Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park

title: Sand Point Temporarily Closed to Off-Trail Travel
description: Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore has temporarily closed Sand Point to all foot traffic to view ice formations effective immediately to protect park resources.

title: Seawall Damage
description: Recent storms have damaged portions of the historic granite seawall along the park’s river boundary. When visiting, please stay on the paved trail for your safety and do not walk, sit, or climb on the seawall.
Park Full Name: Fort McHenry National Monument and Historic Shrine

title: Carter G. Woodson Home NHS temporarily closed.
description: Carter G. Woodson Home National Historic Site is temporarily closed due to a full renovation project. Please continue to visit the website for future updates.
Park Full Name: Carter G. Woodson Home National Historic Site

title: Paying Entrance Fees Online Helps the Park!
description: Please pay your entrance fees before you arrive at the park. Credit or debit card only; no cash, please. It greatly helps the traffic flow. To pay online, click below:

title: Park will NO LONGER Accept Cash - Debit and CC ONLY
description: Starting March 1st, Montezuma Castle and Tuzigoot National Monuments will no longer accept cash for entrance fees. The parks will only accept debit and credit cards. The parks ask all visitors to plan accordingly. See Press release for more information.

title: Park will NO LONGER Accept Cash - Debit and CC ONLY
description: Starting March 1st, Montezuma Castle and Tuzigoot National Monuments will no longer accept cash for entrance fees. The parks will only accept debit and credit cards. The parks ask all visitors to plan accordingly. See Press release for more information.

title: Ford Mansion and Wick House closed until further notice
description: The Ford Mansion and Wick House are closed until sometime in late spring 2024 due to conservation and renovation work. For more information, see the news release on this website.

title: No Water Available at Black Canyon
description: Water has been turned off for the winter at the North and South Rims of the park, as freezing nighttime temperatures have arrived. Be prepared--bring all water needed for drinking and other purposes.
Park Full Name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park

title: Several park trails closed for peregrine falcon nesting season
description: Areas including Jordan Cliffs Trail, Precipice Trail, and Valley Cove Trail are closed to protect peregrine falcons from human disturbance or harassment during an annual nesting period.

title: Bryce Canyon is Open - No Reservations Required to Enter
description: No reservations are required to enter Bryce Canyon National Park at any time of year. Simply pay your park entrance fee or present your America the Beautiful pass upon arrival.

title: Change to Summer Operating Hours
description: ***Please Be Aware*** The park will NOT be changing days of operation. The park will be open Tuesday-Saturday through the summer and winter seasons.

title: Franklin Canyon Park is Closed until further notice.
description: Franklin Canyon Park is CLOSED until further notice at both entrances. Park is CLOSED to all vehicles and pedestrians at both entrances due to hazardous conditions.
Park Full Name: Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area

title: Sandburg Home Visitor Center/Park Store and Tours Open Wednesday to Sunday
description: The Sandburg Home Visitor Center/Park Store is open Wednesday to Sunday from 10am-4pm. Tours are available at 11am, 12pm, 1pm, 2pm, 3pm. Advance reservations are strongly recommended as day-of visit, last minute tickets may not be available.
Park Full Name: Carl Sandburg Home National Historic Site

title: Road Closure: Marshall Hall Access Road
description: The Marshall Hall Access Road is closed due to construction. This road connects the Marshall Hall ruins to Marshall Hall Rd. The main road remains open.

title: Campground will be closed from March 11 - April 24
description: The Garden Key Campground will be closed for 45 days because of heavy machinery in the immediate area that will be dredging the moat and relocating the sand. The closure is necessary for the safety of our visitors.

title: Mauna Loa Trail Closed Above Red Hill Cabin
description: Mauna Loa Trail above Red Hill Cabin remains closed due to hazards from the recent eruption. Red Hill Cabin is open and requires a permit for overnight use.

title: Trail Closures on Battle Road Trail
description: Battle Road Trail between Olive Stow Boardwalk to Shadyside Avenue and Lexington Road is closed until late Spring 2024. This will allow for the completion of a trail re-route. Entering closures is prohibited. Please plan accordingly.

title: Parking at Shark Valley is filling to capacity from approx. 10 am to 3 pm
description: Parking at Shark Valley (located on US Hwy 41) during the busy winter season is extremely limited. For those with bike or tram reservations, we suggest arriving as early as 1-1.5 hours ahead of time.

title: County road through the Fort Heiman Unit is Closed to Vehicles Past the Pavilion
description: Fort Heiman is located at 682 Fort Heiman Road, New Concord KY. Due to poor conditions of county roads, the County has posted the loop road closed to vehicles past the park pavilion. Pedestrian access is permitted.

title: The Site is Seasonally Closed
