title: Park Operations Altered Due to Pretty Rocks Landslide
description: Summer access to facilities and services in Denali remains altered due to the Pretty Rocks Landslide and the associated closure of the Park Road at Mile 43. Check here for more information on what to expect.

title: Face Masks Optional
description: The NPS face mask guidance is based on the CDC’s COVID-19 Community Levels tool. Face masks are currently optional at Chattahoochee River National Recreation Area, however you are welcome to wear a mask if it makes you more comfortable.

title: Boater Awareness
description: Please use caution in park waters due to navigational markers that may be missing or moved due to unforeseen circumstances.

title: Expect long lines to enter the park
description: Between March and November, particularly on busy holiday weekends, you may experience long lines at the entrance road. Parking lots at popular trailheads and viewpoints will fill early. Pack your patience and arrive early to avoid crowds.

title: Louisiana Circle Closed
description: Louisiana Circle is closed to vehicles and pedestrians due to slope instability. Navy Circle is open and also provides views of the Mississippi River.

title: Ancestral Chamber temporarily closed
description: Several features within the Monument’s outdoor memorial are temporarily closed due to safety concerns. The Ancestral Chamber is showing signs of stress and must be assessed prior to reopening. See https://www.nps.gov/afbg/learn/news/temp-closure-ac.htm

title: Use Caution on Roads with Debris
description: Flooding has resulted in debris along many roads within the park boundaries. Please use caution when driving on paved roads and watch for road crews at work. Be aware that unimproved and dirt roads may be impassible due to washouts, so plan accordingly.

title: Use Caution with GPS Navigation
description: The new visitor center is located at 17970 US Hwy 30, about one mile north of downtown Hagerman and the old visitor center. Highway signs and GPS navigation may not yet be up-to-date.

title: Covid-19 Response
description: Federal guidelines require masks be worn inside the Whitman Mission National Historic Site Visitor Center while the CDCs COVID-19 Community Level tool shows "High" in Walla Walla County. Check the tool on Fridays to see updates

title: Difficult conditions complicate Cataract Canyon takeouts
description: Hite Ramp is closed. The North Wash take-out is a primitive, unimproved dirt take-out. You will not be able to back a trailer down the dirt slope. Recent washouts have further deteriorated conditions.

title: Appropriate Footwear Required for Cave Tours
description: Visitors are required to wear completely enclosed shoes if participating in a cave tour, like tennis shoes, sneakers or hiking boots. Any type of sandals or shoes with any openings are NOT acceptable.

title: Sidewalk scaffolding at Federal Hall
description: Protective sidewalk scaffolding has been erected around the building to protect the public from falling materials. Later this year, additional scaffolding will be installed while we conduct an in-depth condition assessment of the building façade.

title: Parking & Shuttle Reservations Always Required - See "Know Before You Go" for Details
description: Reservations are required for all personal vehicles and shuttle riders at Muir Woods. You can make your reservation by visiting www.gomuirwoods.com. Visit our "Know Before You Go" webpage to learn more important details before your visit.

title: North Union Avenue and Grant's Circle Closed
description: Due to weather related incidents, North Union Avenue and Grant's Circle are closed to vehicular and recreational traffic. Entering these areas is prohibited. A portion of Grant Avenue is open for touring.

title: Emergency Closures in Burned Areas
description: Closures are in place for some facilities, infrastructure, and areas affected by the 2021 Dixie Fire. Please adhere to all closures indicated by CLOSED signs or described in emergency closure notices.

title: Be Aware of Burned Area Hazards
description: Numerous hazards exist in areas affected by the 2021 Dixie Fire. Be prepared for falling/fallen trees or limbs, loose/falling rock, undefined/unmarked trails, and hidden stump holes. Click more to learn about burned area safety.

title: Off Road Vehicle Inspections UPDATE: 5/27/22
description: Beginning 5/27 ORV renewals & new permits will be issued at the Nathanial P. Reed Visitor Center Friday-Monday, 9am-1:30pm. No permits will be issued Tuesday-Thursday. Permits will be issued first-come first-served. Visit our ORV page for more information

title: Jeremy's Run Trail from the boundary
description: The boundary access to Jeremy's Run Trail across private property at State Route 611 is temporarily closed by the landowner. The park trail remains open. Hikers must access Jeremy's Run from Skyline Drive. The park is working to resolve the situation.

title: Expect Crowding
description: Parking lots and popular destinations are crowded especially on weekends and days with warm weather between 10 a.m. and 3 p.m.

title: Bringing a Pet to Big Bend?
description: Bringing your pet to Big Bend National Park will limit some of your park explorations and opportunities. Pets are not allowed on park trails, in the backcountry, or on the river. Pets are allowed only where vehicles can go. Pets may not be left unattended

title: Reservations No Longer Needed for House Tours
description: We are no longer taking reservations for house tours unless you have a group of 10 or more people. Daily tours will be offered on a first-come, first-served basis with a max of 10 people / tour.

title: Closure of Old Fort: Monday through Wednesday
description: The old fort will be closed on Mondays, Tuesdays, and Wednesdays. Park Grounds - Open: 7:00 a.m. to sunset daily

title: Operating Hours & Seasons
description: The park is normally open year-round during daylight hours. Some park facilities are closed during the winter.
Park Full Name: Saint Croix Island International Historic Site

title: Dangerous Highway Crossing
description: Highway 177 is 60 mph with a blind spot directly across from the house. Safely use the highway underpass to the Fox Creek Trail just south of the visitor center parking lot. Be smart, stay alive.

title: No Dogs on Beach
description: Dogs and pets are not allowed on any of the beaches in Gulf Islands National Seashore. Visit the pet rules page for information.

title: COVID-19 Mask Requirement
description: Mask requirements vary from park to park and are dependent upon local public health status.

title: COVID-19 Mask Requirement
description: The NPS has updated its masking guidance based on the CDC’s COVID-19 Community Levels tool. Masking requirements will vary along the parkway based on local conditions. Masks are still required on all forms of enclosed public transportation.

title: Visitor Contact Station Open
description: In accordance with CDC recommendations, state, and county health guidance, we have resumed visitor services with modified operations. CDC guidance for COVID-19 includes social distancing. Mask wearing is now optional inside all NPS buildings.

title: Face masks are now optional
description: As Covid-related numbers have dipped below the CDC determined High Rate of Transmission in Adams County, Mississippi, face masks are no longer required in all NPS buildings at Natchez National Historical Park. Wearing of face masks is optional.

title: Masks are Optional in the White House Visitor Center
description: Consistent with CDC guidance regarding areas of low transmission (Washington, DC is currently low), the wearing of masks in the White House Visitor Center is optional.

title: Rip Current Status
description: Review rip current status prior to visiting the park.

title: Fee Stations Credit Card Only
description: Fee Stations are only accepting credit cards for the purchase of entry tickets and passes.
Park Full Name: Castillo de San Marcos National Monument

title: Portrait Photography Requires a Permit
description: Any portrait photography session (school photos, family portraits, engagement photos, etc.) requires a permit. Visit our Permits and Reservations Page for call 203-834-1896 x13 for more info.

title: Stamp Status
description: Unfortunately, since we are not an official park yet, we do not currently have a park stamp.

title: Fee Stations Credit Card Only
description: Fee Stations are only accepting credit cards for the purchase of passes. Visitors can also purchase digital passes in advance at www.recreation.gov/sitepass/74285

title: High Crowds & Park Capacity
description: High visitation may require limiting access to Bear Gulch and other parking areas in the park. If all parking lots reach capacity, incoming traffic will not pass the campground until space is available. This occurs most often between 8a and 3p on weekends

title: Phones Are Not Operational
description: We continue to experience intermittent outages with our phone lines. If your call does not go through, please try again later, or try to leave us a message and we will get back to you. Thank you for your understanding.

title: Canyon from Toe of Exit Glacier to the Outwash Plain
description: The canyon from the toe of Exit Glacier to where Exit Creek opens into the Outwash Plain is susceptible to sudden outburst flood events. These events produce sudden surges of water, ice and rock. The canyon is dangerous and travel is not recommended.

title: Fort Pulaski Entrance Fees are Credit/Debit Only
description: The park is no longer accepting cash for entrance fees. Credit and debit cards are the only method of payment currently being accepted.

title: Bike rentals are not available at this time
description: Bike rentals on Cumberland Island are not available at this time. Although rental bikes will not be available, with a reservation and a modest fee the ferry can transport up to 15 personal bikes to the island.

title: All 3 petroglyph viewing trails are open. No trails at VC. WNPA Park Store open 9am - 4pm.
description: Drive to petroglyph viewing trails: Boca Negra Canyon (open 8:30 am - 4 pm); Rinconada and Piedras Marcadas Canyons (open 8 am to 5 pm). The Volcanoes Day Use Area (no petroglyphs, open 9 am to 5 pm). WNPA Park Store open for shopping 9am - 4pm daily.

title: Tickets are required to enter Mammoth Cave
description: Reservations are strongly recommended. Reservations are the only way to ensure a spot is available for your party. Please plan accordingly by visiting Recreation.gov to secure your tickets in advance. Availability of walk-up tickets is not guaranteed.

title: White House Overlook and Trail Closed
description: White House Overlook and Trail, one of seven overlooks and the only public trail on the South Rim Drive, remains closed because of safety and law enforcement concerns.

title: RVs, Trailers and Other Oversized Vehicles (Limited Parking)
description: Due to increased visitation, parking lots often fill up early. Visitors need to be aware that parking for larger vehicles is very limited. RVs using "tow dollies" may have to unhook towed vehicles in order to turn around in the parking lot on busy days.

title: Park in Progress
description: Coltsville NHP is working toward establishment and is not yet an official park. We do not have a Visitor Center and visitor services are limited. For more information please visit our Park Development and Calendar pages.

title: Abandoned Mines Hazard
description: Abandoned mines exist on park lands. Explosives, mine openings, unsafe structures and toxic chemicals may be present. Visitors should use extreme caution and avoid abandoned mineral properties.

title: Park Movie
description: Due to technical difficulties, the captioning on our park movie is not currently working and the lighting is not consistently dimming in the site's theater. For a captioned version, you can visit www.nps.gov/fosc/learn/photosmultimedia/fsmvideos.htm

title: No Fuel Services
description: Fuel up before visiting! Agate Fossil Beds National Monument is 30-50 miles from the nearest service stations.

title: Limited Cell Phone Coverage
description: Cell phone voice and data coverage is very limited in the park and surrounding area. Free visitor WiFi is available in the visitor center.

title: Possession or use of marijuana inside Fire Island National Seashore is prohibited.
description: While New York provides for regulated possession and use of marijuana, it remains an illegal drug under federal law and enforced within National Park units.

title: Mauna Loa Summit Closed
description: The summit of Mauna Loa is closed to all day hiking and overnight camping due to high winds and a winter weather advisory.

title: Trail Alerts
description: Trail closures are reported to the North Country Trail Association. Go to their Trail Alerts page for the latest information.

title: Navigation
description: Do not rely on GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Badlands National Park. Please note that the Visitor Center at 25216 Ben Reifel Road, Interior SD 57750 is located just off I-90.

title: Trail Conditions
description: Trail conditions can vary throughout the state. Before heading out, check the trail conditions, potential re-routes and closures on the Ice Age Trail Alliance website.

title: Closure of Anza Expedition Exhibit at Martinez Adobe in Martinez, CA
description: For safety reasons, access to the Martinez Adobe, which houses the Anza exhibit, is blocked off from the public and remains closed for all use until the structure is stabilized. Currently, there is no timeline for the repairs to be complete...

title: Butterfield Trail Closure
description: The Butterfield Trail is currently closed to horses and pack animals. It remains open for hiking and foot traffic. For more information, see our policy page.

title: Paddling Hazard Upstream from Lock 39/Rockside Road
description: A significant woody debris hazard exists near a set of metal pylons and timber groynes just upstream from the Lock 39/Rockside Rd. access. Do not attempt to paddle through during medium/low flow. Portage on river right. .

title: What To Know Before You Visit
description: Park grounds and visitor center are open, but you're encouraged to call the visitor center at 318-926-5492 for the latest information and COVID-19 precautions before you visit.

title: Motorized Recreational Scooters Not Permitted in Park
description: For the safety and protection of visitors and park resources, motorized scooters are not permitted within the park. Any vehicles (scooters, bicycles, etc.) that are part of a ride-share program may not be left behind for pick up inside the park
Park Full Name: Fort McHenry National Monument and Historic Shrine

title: Be Prepared for your Visit
description: Before hiking at Moores Creek, make sure to bring all your necessary medications, sunscreen, bottled water for hikes, loose fitting clothes for hiking, and any other items you may need.

title: Rip Currents and Rough Surf
description: Remember that rough surf is dangerous & rip currents can be deadly. Please use caution when swimming at Canaveral National Seashore.

title: Closure: Portion of the Village Trail
description: The river bank section of trail near the Sakakawea Village is closed due to ongoing erosion until further notice. The village site itself remains accessible by hiking from the visitor center.
Park Full Name: Knife River Indian Villages National Historic Site

title: Battery Kemble Park Parking Area Closed Until Further Notice
description: As a public health precaution, some facilities in Rock Creek Park are temporarily closed for the safety of staff and visitors. Updates will be posted to the park website, www.nps.gov/cwdw and on Facebook: @CWDWNPS Info: 202-895-6000

title: Burned Area Safety Advisory
description: The Carr Fire has increased risks to visitors; falling trees, broken and hanging limbs, burned out stump holes, abandoned mine features, and loose rocks remain in much of the burned area. Remember to watch the ground you walk on, as well as above you.

title: COVID-19 (Coronavirus) Information
description: To keep the public informed during the ongoing public health incident, NPS has created a webpage with the latest information and updates about COVID-19. It is available by clicking "more" below.

title: Closures: Detours; Towpath; Points of Interest
description: Multiple items are closed due to hazardous conditions or maintenance. See below for more details.
Park Full Name: Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park

title: Uber, Lyft, and other "Taxi" Services
description: While Pecos is close to Santa Fe and Las Vegas, services like Uber and Lyft may have limited availability to and from the park. If you are able to take an Uber or Lyft, please make sure you have plans to be picked up before being dropped off at Pecos.

title: Bicycle Use In The Monument
description: Bicycles are ONLY allowed at the following locations: 1 - On the Boca Negra Canyon paved multiuse path; bicycles must remain on the paved bike path. 2 - On the crusher fine trail that winds in and out of the park around the mesa top above Boca Negra.

title: Water in Campground is Shut Off
description: The water in the campground has been shut off for the winter due to freezing temperatures. Visitors are encouraged to bring their own supply. Small water containers may also be filled in the visitor center during business hours (9 am - 5 pm).

title: Yockanookany Trail Section Closed to Equestrians
description: The Yockanookany section of the Natchez Trace National Scenic Trail is closed to equestrian use effective immediately, due to safety concerns with trail bridges and boardwalks. The trail will remain open to pedestrians.

title: Notice to travelers to National Cemetery
description: Due to the narrow roadway & tight turn, RVs, mobile homes, charter buses, delivery trucks, or vehicles with trailers are prohibited from the crest of Monument Hill. Check for information about parking at the Visitor Center upon your arrival.

title: Weather Closures
description: Open areas of the park may be closed on short notice due to concern of possible debris flows during rain events. Smaller scale landslides and flood may occur anywhere within the park during rain events.

title: RV and Tractor Trailer Parking at the Visitor Center
description: There is limited space for parking for recreational vehicles and trailers in the parking lot directly in front (south) of the visitor center. RVs are asked to not park in the lot behind the visitor center. There is no parking space for tractor trailers.

title: Federal Government Shutdown
description: During the federal government shutdown, this website will not be updated and may not reflect current conditions. The tour of the Old Post Office Tower is closed for resource protection and safety.

title: Drones are Prohibited in Fort Pulaski National Monument
description: The use of drones or other remote-controlled unmanned aircraft, is prohibited in the park for issues relating to visitor safety and experience, and wildlife and resource protection. For more info, see section 1.5(a)(1) of the Superintendent's Compendium.

title: GPS Navigation Systems
description: GPS navigation systems often misdirect visitors driving to Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site. GPS systems often route visitors to our back gate, or to the entrance for Grant's Farm (not affiliated with the NPS). Please visit our directions page.
Park Full Name: Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site

title: Footwear in the Cavern
description: For safety, closed-toe shoes with good traction are recommended. Flip flops, sandals, and some walking shoes have little or no traction and increase the possibility of slips, trips, and falls. Watch your step and use the handrails when necessary.

title: Unmanned Aircraft (Drones) Are Prohibited
description: The use of unmanned aircraft, also known as drones, is prohibited within Carlsbad Caverns National Park.

title: Partial Closure of Rocky Springs Trail
description: The Rocky Springs section is closed from the Rocky Springs campground at milepost 55 to the northern terminus at milepost 59 until further notice. Visitors should observe posted closures. The trail is unsafe due to trail erosion and deteriorated bridges.

title: Arrival by Boat
description: It is prohibited to come within 1/4 mile of the Kalaupapa shoreline. Access by boat within the quarter mile offshore park boundary requires a special use permit.

title: Garden Key Harbor Light
description: Vessel operators - the Garden Key Harbor Light is undergoing repairs and is extinguished. At this time it is unknown when the light will again be illuminated.

title: Warning about GPS Systems!
description: Vehicle Navigation Systems and GPS units may provide inaccurate information—sending drivers the wrong way on one-way roads, leading them to dead ends in remote areas, or sending them on roads which are impassable. Use the Interstate exits for wayfinding.

title: Private Property: Sand & Rocky Islands
description: Reminder: There are private holdings on the southeast corner of Sand Island, and just north of Group Site A on Rocky Island. It is trespassing to be on their property, including their docks. Stay out of those clearly marked areas or you can be fined.

title: Please be prepared while hiking in the park
description: Ensure you have plenty of water (about 1 quart of water per hour while hiking), salty snacks and/or electrolytes, sun protection, and appropriate hiking gear. Assess the weather and your personal preparedness before you set off on the trail.

title: Hiking Advisory
description: Due to high winds and rainfall from thunderstorms, damaged trees have fallen across many sections of the National Scenic Trail. Caution is advised on all trails. Be aware of your surroundings while hiking and look for overhead limbs that may pose a hazard

title: Richmond National Battlefield Park No Longer Sells Senior or Annual National Park Passes
description: Richmond National Battlefield Park does not sell the Senior or Annual National Park Service passes. For a list of sites that do sell passes, please visit https://store.usgs.gov/pass/annual.html

title: All natural and cultural resources are protected
description: The removal of any artifact, antler, obsidian, and other mineral or plant material is strictly prohibited.

title: Life Jackets Required!
description: By Nebraska State law, all children 12 years old and younger must WEAR a USCG approved life jacket to float the Niobrara NSR. Anyone over 12 years old must HAVE a life jacket. If you are renting equipment, your outfitter will provide them.

title: Test Alert
description: Test Alert

title: Toe of Exit Glacier, Ice Fall Hazard Zone
description: An ice fall hazard zone has been identified at the toe and sides of Exit Glacier, due to tall blocks and slabs of ice. For your safety, entry into this zone is prohibited. Please do not continue past ice fall hazard signs and see photo for more details.

title: Navigation
description: Please do not rely upon GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Craters of the Moon. Please note that the Visitor Center at 1266 Craters Loop Road is located just off U.S. Highway 20/26/93 and is not accessed via any unpaved roads.
Park Full Name: Craters of the Moon National Monument and Preserve

title: Attention Visitors, Cab drivers, Uber drivers, and transportation service drivers
description: DO NOT drop off your passengers at the visitor center. No trail access. Visitors must be driven to a trail system from the visitor center. If passengers want to go to the visitor center, WAIT FOR THEM in the parking lot until they come back out.

title: Winter Weather Information
description: Park grounds remain open in snowy or icy weather, however parking areas are not cleared until 1-3 days after snowfall ends. Trails and parking lot may be icy or uncleared. Use caution if driving to the park and onsite as conditions may be hazardous.

title: No Cell Service or WiFi
description: We do not recommend taking a rideshare or taxi to Muir Woods. There is NO cell service or wifi at Muir Woods. When hiring a taxi visitors have the option of negotiating a flat rate, or using the meter. Under some circumstances a flat rate may be cheaper.

title: Delta-01 Tour Fee and Reservations
description: All Delta-01 Launch Control Facility Tours require advanced reservations. Reservations can be made up to 90 days in advance on-line or by phone at 605-717-7629. No SAME-DAY tours available during the summer season.

title: Glover-Archbold trail detour
description: For visitor safety, the southern end of the Glover-Archbold Trail is under an emergency closure until further notice due to aerial hazards. Please follow the posted detour along Foxhall Rd. / 44th St. NW / P St. NW.

title: The Use of Drones is Prohibited at Big South Fork National River & Recreation Area
description: Currently, the use of drones is prohibited at Big South Fork and all National Parks. Detailed information about the policy is available...
Park Full Name: Big South Fork National River and Recreation Area

title: White-Nose Syndrome / Cave Permit
description: Please Do Not bring clothing or caving gear used in caves or mines outside of Lava Beds into our caves. This will help slow the spread of white-nose syndrome, a bat disease that is killing bats outside of the park.

title: Brandywine Falls Safety Alert
description: Do not climb the rocks, over the fenced areas, or Brandywine Falls. Please enjoy Brandywine Falls safely by staying at least 50 feet from the top and bottom of the falls. Approaching too close can result in serious injury or death.

title: Firewood ban is in effect for the park.
description: Firewood ban is in effect for the park. Only firewood from the surrounding counties of Scott, Morgan, Pickett, and Fentress, in Tennessee, and McCreary in Kentucky, can be brought into the park. Firewood is for sale or you may use dead and down wood.
Park Full Name: Big South Fork National River and Recreation Area

title: Black Bears at Big South Fork
description: Black bears call Big South Fork NRRA home. Help keep them healthy and safe by storing all food, cooking items, feed, cosmetics and coolers properly stored when at campgrounds or in the backcountry.
Park Full Name: Big South Fork National River and Recreation Area

title: Unmanned Aircraft
description: Launching, landing, or operating an unmanned aircraft from or on lands and waters administered by the National Park Service within the boundaries of Kalaupapa National Historical Park is prohibited. This includes model airplanes, quadcopters, and drones.

title: General Mosquito Information
description: Although there is no known current transmission of dengue, Zika, or chikungunya, American Samoa has had recent outbreaks, and reintroduction is possible. Avoid mosquito bites and report to your doctor if you get sick within two weeks of returning.

title: Current East Rim Trail Status
description: Click "more" to find out if the East Rim Trail is open for today. In good conditions trail is open 6:00 a.m. - 11:00 p.m. for bikers and as posted for other trail users. In wet or hazardous conditions, the trail will close to all users to prevent damage.

title: Winter Closure Hotline
description: With winter weather a possibility, Springfield Armory has set up a Weather Delay/Closure hotline for up to the minute information. Please call 413-734-8551 then enter extension 300 for weather updates.

title: Vehicle Break-Ins: Take precautions to secure your vehicle and valuables.
description: This is an urban park. Don't hide valuables inside your car. Carry items with you on hike. Lock your vehicle and set car alarm. Recent auto break-ins at Rinconada Canyon parking lot. Report suspicious persons loitering/peeking in cars. Call 928-638-7805

title: Wild Bison
description: Bison graze in both Windmill and West Traps pastures. Sightings may be at schoolhouse parking area. Bison will defend themselves if they feel threatened. Keep 100 yards distance. A raised tail is a warning sign: bison may charge or give chase.

title: Be Aware of Break-ins along State Route 20
description: Prevent smashed windows and theft. Break-ins are not uncommon at trailheads along State Route 20. Remove your valuables and electronics and take associated electronic cords.

title: Weir House, Weir Studio, Young Studio, Visitor Center, and Restrooms Closed
description: Please note starting November 1st all park buildings are closed for the season. Park grounds are open daily year-round and maps, brochures, and passport stamp are available in the parking lot kiosk. Restrooms are not available during the off-season.

title: Melting snow bridges and high streamflows create hazards for hikers, skiers, and snowshoers.
description: Be aware of hidden- and potentially fatal- hazards created by snow bridges and high streamflows on Mount Rainier.

title: Being Prepared for a Wilderness Experience
description: Some of the park's trails require advanced navigation (compass & maps), climbing over downed trees & crossing through water. Please choose trails that fit your preferences & abilities. Visit the Trail Information page to learn more about the park's trails

title: If you have been redirected from the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail Route
description: You were redirected to this site from the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail Route because of a sunset clause in the Trail's federal legislation, the NPS lost its legislative authority to manage the trail after 9-30-2011.

title: Kentucky Boyhood Home at Knob Creek Unit Visitor Center has Seasonal Hours
description: The Knob Creek Visitor Center and Knob Creek Cabin are closed for winter season. The grounds at the Kentucky Boyhood Home at Knob Creek Unit are open from sunrise to sunset. The Visitor Center at the Birthplace Unit and Symbolic Cabin are open year round.
Park Full Name: Abraham Lincoln Birthplace National Historical Park

title: Tioga Road, Glacier Point Road, and Mariposa Grove Road are closed for the winter
description: Tioga Road (continuation of Highway 120 through the park) and Glacier Point Road are closed for the season due to snow. They usually open in late May or June. Call 209/372-0200 (then 1, 1) for road conditions and tire chain requirements.

title: Delayed Opening of Visitor Center on Wednesday, 04/03
description: The visitor center at George Washington Birthplace National Monument will have a delayed opening at 11:30 a.m. on Wednesday, 04/03. Park grounds will be open 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

title: Winter Trail Closures
description: The Wall St. side of Navajo Loop is expected to remain closed until Memorial Day weekend. The Two Bridges side remains open. The Rim Trail between Inspiration and Bryce Points remains closed. The Rim Trail is open north of Inspiration Point.

title: Main Road Status
description: The main park road is fully open to Rainbow Point (Mile 18 of 18). All park roads are currently open for the season. During snowstorms the road may temporarily close at Mile 3 for snowplow operations.

title: Water Line break at VC April 2nd 2024
description: UPDATE: The visitor center will be open today but there is no water due to the water line break. Porta Potties are located in the parking lot.

title: Columns Drive entrance of Cochran Shoals Closed
description: Columns Drive entrance of Cochran Shoals is closed. There will be no access at this entrance during the duration of the project. Please visit Cochran Shoals at Sope Creek or Interstate North during the closure. For updates or information call 678-538-1200

title: Active Bee Season
description: Please use caution and be aware of your surroundings when visiting the park due to possible encounters with active beehives this season.
Park Full Name: San Antonio Missions National Historical Park

title: Cherry Blossom Welcome Area Closed on Wednesday, April 3
description: Due to forecast hazardous weather, the Tidal Basin Welcome Area for the National Cherry Blossom Festival will be closed on Wednesday, April 3. The activity tents and entertainment stage will operate again on Thursday, April 4.

title: Post-Flood Trail Conditions
description: Some standing water on Oakridge, River, Kingsnake, Bates Ferry & Fork Swamp Trails. Muddy conditions should be expected on these as well as Weston Lake Trail.

title: What's Closed and What's Open? (Park Operational Updates) Tuesday, April 2, 2024
description: The Visitor Center is OPEN from 10 am to 4 pm today. Ranger programs are being presented today. NOTE: Visitor Center hours change April 7. Visit the link for details and a list of available visitor services, and their hours of operation.

title: Tuesday, April 2, 2024 - Sunny, with a South Rim High of 59°F (15°C) South Rim Roads Are Open
description: The North Rim of the park and State Route 67 are CLOSED to all vehicle traffic for the winter, until May 15. Bright Angel Trail, Plateau Point and Tonto Trails are CLOSED for waterline construction through April 14.

title: Construction Under Way on Site
description: Watch your step and be aware of open excavations. Stop, look, and listen for trucks. Avoid moving equipment and stay clear of work areas. Parents, please warn children about the dangers present onsite. Safety first!

title: 111th Street Bridge to I-94 Closed for Construction
description: A full closure of the 111th St. bridge to I-94 is required for repairs. Motorists should follow the posted detour starting April 1.

title: Phones Down
description: Phone lines at the visitor center are currently not working. Please contact us via email or message us on social media. (Click/tap "more" below.)

title: April 21, 2024: Summer Hours Begin
description: Effective Sunday, April 21, Steamtown NHS will be open daily, from 9:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.

title: Tennessee Valley Trail Temporarily Closed Until Further Notice
description: Following an assessment from the park's maintenance team, the trail segment going to beach is closed for visitor safety. See link for more information about the trail and safety closure.

title: Visitor Center Services Temporarily Relocated on April 9, 2024
description: Due to scheduled utility work on Tuesday April 9th, the visitor center operations will temporarily relocate to the Surrender House (Tour Stop #10). Visitor Center operations will resume at their regular location on Wednesday, April 10th.

title: Resurfacing Rim Rock Drive
description: Project work runs from 4/2- 8/5. There will be delays of up to 15 minutes and occasional road closures between DS Rd and Independence Monument View. Visit the project page for a full work schedule.

title: 9:30 am Fairgrounds Tour and 11:30 am Garden of Eden Tour cancelled April 9, 2024
description: To allow staff to participate in the Adventures in Nature program, the 9:30 am Fairgrounds Tour and 11:30 am Garden of Eden Tour on April 9, 2024 are cancelled.

title: Loop Road, Campground, and Trails Closed to All Vehicle and Foot Traffic April 1-12
description: The Loop Road, Lava Flow Campground, and all hiking trails are closed to all vehicle and foot traffic for safety reasons while snow removal and road maintenance take place. This message will be updated as conditions change.
Park Full Name: Craters of the Moon National Monument and Preserve

title: Paradise Road Status on 4/02/24: Road CLOSED
description: The gate to Paradise at Longmire is closed Tuesday and Wednesday. All vehicles, including 4WD and AWD vehicles, are required to carry tire chains Nov 1 - May 1.

title: Temporary Closure of southwestern end of Drakes Beach due to the presence of elephant seals.
description: Until further notice, Drakes Beach is closed to all entry west (e.g., to the right when facing Drakes Bay) of the Kenneth C. Patrick Visitor Center to the year-round closure area at the southwest end of Drakes Beach.

title: Prescribed Burns April 5-7, 2024
description: Sections of park upland trails (Longleaf, Bluff, Firefly) may be closed 4/5-4/7 for prescribed burns. Longleaf & Bluff Campgrounds will be closed 4/4-4/7. All trail closures will be clearly marked. Smoke may be seen for several miles. Please use caution.

title: Hurricane Ridge Road Status 3/31/24
description: Beginning April 1, 2024, Hurricane Ridge Road will remain open 7 days a week unless snow conditions or rocks in the roadway prohibit safe travel. If road safety becomes an issue, the gate will be closed after Heart o' the Hills entrance.

title: Public Phone Line Is Down
description: The public phone line is down temporarily. Please leave a voice message and staff will return your call as soon as possible.

title: Visitor Center Parking Lot Gate Locked at 5 PM
description: Due to damage caused by vandalism, the automatic gate to our visitor center parking lot is not functioning. The gate will be locked at 5 PM daily until further notice. All vehicles must be out of the park by 5 PM. There will be no late exit option.

title: NPS 300 Road Conditions
description: NPS 300 to Big Tubes is muddy with some two-foot-deep ruts. A four-wheel-drive, high clearance vehicle is required. Road may become impassable with continued snow and freezing-thawing conditions.

title: Cave Tours are Back!
description: The 2024 season has begun! Demand during spring break is high. Early sellouts are common. Be sure to call ahead for current conditions before driving and walking 60-minutes to the visitor center. 541-592-5125.
Park Full Name: Oregon Caves National Monument and Preserve

title: Cades Cove Loop Road and Laurel Creek Road are open
description: Upper Tremont Road remains closed due to downed trees.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Several park roads closed due to downed trees and high winds', 'id': '7C954922-38A9-4313-8F50-62542106A0E2', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/grsm/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: Temporary Closure at Machete Ridge
description: The area within the following boundary is closed to public access for the protection of wildlife: The southern portion of the Machete Ridge rock formation and access trails are closed to climbing and off-trail hiking. Please review the closure posting.

title: Some Winter Seasonal Road Closures Remain In Effect
description: It is still winter in the mountains, and some roads remain under a seasonal closure. To see which roads are closed, click on the "more" link:

title: Angels Landing Closed for Planned Maintenance
description: On April 1, 2, 3, and 4, Zion is doing routine trail maintenance and is not issuing permits for hikes to Angels Landing. You can apply on April 4 for hikes on April 5. Learn about other permit lotteries.

title: Sections of Palo Comado Canyon Trail Closed April 1, 2024 through April 4, 2024
description: Palo Comado Canyon Trail, between the junctions with Chesebro Road (southern end of closure) and Sheep Corral Trail (northern end of closure) will be closed from April 1st through April 4th, 2024, 8a.m. to 5p.m. each day, due to winter storm repairs.
Park Full Name: Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area

title: Cave Tour Reservations Are Strongly Recommended - Walkup Tickets Are Not Guaranteed
description: Advance cave tour reservations are available on recreation.gov through May 31st. Reservations for June will become available early May. The reservations close at noon the day before. Reservations are the best way to ensure tickets for your group.

title: Road Construction Update - Delays and Closures Start April 2024
description: Phase one of this major road improvement project starts April 1, 2024 with alternating one-way traffic (15-minute stops/delays) starting at the park entrance on Hwy 347. Tomichi Point parking lot and viewpoint will be closed for the month of April.
Park Full Name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park

title: Road Construction at Black Canyon South Rim - 2024 and 2025
description: Major road improvement projects will impact the park from April-November 2024. Expect delays, alternating one-way traffic, and parking lot closures from the park boundary on Hwy 347 to the visitor center. Drive with extra caution. More road work in 2025.
Park Full Name: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park

title: Bayside Day Use Area Temporary Closure
description: The Bayside Parking Area, Bayside Beach and Bayside Picnic Area will be closed for construction beginning Monday April 1st. This area will be Closed to all Visitors until work is completed.

title: TEMPORARY FIRE BAN in the Chisos Mountains
description: High Temps and strong winds have resulted in extreme fire conditions. There is currently a fire ban in the Chisos Mountains for Sunday, 3/31, and Monday, 4/1. All fires are prohibited including charcoal grills. Liquid fuel camp stoves are allowed.

title: Road from Park Headquarters to Rim Village is Temporarily CLOSED
description: The road is temporarily closed due to large snow drifts and equipment issues. There is no estimated date for reopening and it will remain closed through the weekend. It is not possible to access a lake view by vehicle. Expect snowy, icy, and narrow roads
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Road from Park Headquarters to Rim Village is Temporarily CLOSED', 'id': '20B0C333-AEBC-4985-AE34-A3814EB3DC2F', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/crla/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: Passenger Ferry Dock Closed
description: The ferry dock servicing the Cape Lookout Lighthouse area is closed for repairs. During high tide, visitors will have to use an alternative route cut through the grass. Visitors should wear sturdy, closed toe shoes because of potential hazards.

title: Cima Road between Cima and Interstate 15 CLOSED Until Late June 2024
description: Cima Road between Kelso Cima Road in Cima and Interstate 15 along the north preserve boundary is CLOSED to all vehicles. Please do not drive around barricades, or cross this active construction zone in the Cima Dome area.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Cima Road Closed to ALL VEHICLES due to Construction', 'id': '734DA552-488D-4A3F-979D-751E95AB05CA', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/moja/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: Several park roads closed for the season
description: The following roads are closed for the season: Clingmans Dome, Heintooga Round Bottom, Heintooga Ridge, Parson Branch, and Rich Mountain. Opening dates vary from mid-April to early-May.

title: Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail Closure through Scotts Run Nature Preserve
description: Scotts Run Nature Preserve will be temporarily closed during the repair of wastewater pipes to maintain the safety of the public and to preserve the natural resources throughout the site.

title: Seasonal Canyon Closures
description: April 1 - August 31, 2024, the following are closed to the public to protect sensitive resources: the heads of Burro Wash and Fivemile Wash continuing east 2 miles. Shinob Canyon and any route descending into Shinob, including Na-gah, Nighthawk, & Timpie.

title: High Visitation during the months of March, April, and May
description: Spring is upon us, we expect high visitation at Saguaro National Park during March, April, & May. There is limited parking at the Rincon Mountain Visitor Center (east side). Large vehicles may find difficulty parking on the east side. Call for more info.

title: Periodic Closures of Signal Hill Picnic Area (Tucson Mountain District)
description: Periodic closures of the Signal Hill Picnic Area will be in effect through May 2024 to allow for the completion of a major repair and improvement project. Please click this link for further information and a calendar of upcoming closures.

title: Visitor Center building closed; Passes available at Entrance Gate, trails & overlooks Open
description: The Great Falls Visitor Center building is temporarily closed until further notice for needed construction projects. Overlooks & Trails OPEN. Park closed at dark 7:30 pm.

title: Abó Visitor Center and Restrooms Closed April 1st, 2nd, and 3rd
description: Due to staffing logistics, the Abó visitor center and restrooms will be closed on 4/01,02, and 03. The trails will remain open from 9 am - 4 pm. Restrooms are available at the headquarters visitor center. For questions, call headquarters at 505-847-2585.

title: Park Closure on Monday, April 8
description: The visitor center will be closed on Mon., Apr. 8. Staff will be at the University of Arkansas at Hope campus as we partner with them for the total eclipse. Please join us at 2500 St. Main St., Hope, AR 71801 for special programming.
Park Name: President William Jefferson Clinton Birthplace Home
Park Full Name: President William Jefferson Clinton Birthplace Home National Historic Site

title: Limited Access to Second Floor of JFK Birthplace Begins 2/13
description: Beginning February 13, the nursery and bathroom on the second floor of the house will be undergoing restoration work. This work will be ongoing. Until it is complete, there will be limited or no access to the second floor for reserved off season tours.
Park Full Name: John Fitzgerald Kennedy National Historic Site

title: Warning Siren Test at Trego Dam, Trego, WI:
description: The semi-annual test of the Trego Dam failure warning sirens will be conducted on Monday, April 1, 2024, at 11:00 am. The test will last about 90 seconds. This is conducted by Xcel Energy in coordination with Washington Co., local townships, and NPS.

title: Exhibit Change
description: Exhibit space will be under construction on 4/25 & 4/26 as we change from "Beyond Camelot" to "Leaders in Literacy." The Education Center will remain open during this time and Saxton House tour will still leave from the Education Center.

title: Historic Homes Closed for Winter Season
description: The historic homes are closed for the winter season and unavailable for tours. The homes will reopen May 1st. The Visitor Center is open 10am-4pm Monday-Friday.

title: Mojave Road CLOSED across Soda Lake Crossing
description: March rains have caused the Soda Lake area to become too muddy for safe driving and will cause resource damage. drivers who go through closed area may be financially responsible for restoration and could get an expensive towing fee. Detour via I-15.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Soda Lake Crossing CLOSED again for Mojave Road', 'id': '156A62E5-EE42-49F6-9C8E-13A422C69B57', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/moja/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: Temporary Vehicle Restriction on Mauna Loa Road
description: Mauna Loa Road will be restricted to hiking, biking, and official vehicles only during the Merrie Monarch Festival, from 6:00 pm Friday, March 29th to 6:00 pm Sunday, April 7th.

title: Casa Grande Ruins Picnic Area is closed through April 30, 2024
description: Casa Grande Ruins picnic area is closed March 28 - April 30, 2024, due to the density of an invasive and noxious weed called Stinknet, which can cause skin rashes and serious breathing problems. The park is working to open it back up as soon as possible.

title: Road Construction Delays April 1 to Mid-August 2024
description: Road construction in the park from April 1 to mid-August 2024. Weekly updates on construction activities and locations in the park will be posted on the Bighorn Canyon Facebook page. Visitors can also call 307-548-5406 for current conditions.

title: Birth Home Temporarily Closed For Repairs
description: The birth home of Martin Luther King, Jr. is temporarily closed for repairs. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. All other buildings at the Martin Luther King, Jr. National Historical Park remain open during regular park operating hours.
Park Full Name: Martin Luther King, Jr., National Historical Park

title: Mansion ADA Inclined platform lift not functional as of March 27, 2024
description: Mansion ADA Inclined platform lift not functional as of March 27, 2024. Until further notice the Mansion tour is not ADA accessible. We apologize for any inconvenience.

title: Tours By Appointment Unavailable on Set Dates in April and May 2024
description: Due to pre-existing educational programming and training, off season tours by appointment are unavailable on the following dates: April - 4/8, 4/10, 4/12, and 4/15; May - 5/20 through 5/31
Park Full Name: John Fitzgerald Kennedy National Historic Site

title: Historic carriage roads closed until further notice for "mud season"
description: An earlier spring thaw has led to earlier closures to protect Acadia's historic carriage roads during "mud season" in Maine. Walking, bicycling or riding horses on them in these wet and soft conditions can cause significant damage.

title: Jordan Pond Road closed due to bridge repair project
description: Jordan Pond Road is closed to through traffic as part of a bridge repair project. Stanley Brook Road will remain open to provide access the Jordan Pond area.

title: Road Delays at Chapin Mesa Tunnel April 2 to 3
description: On Tuesday April 2 and Wednesday April 3, expect up to 15-minute delays between 8:00 AM and 6:00 PM. This affects traffic in both directions at the Chapin Mesa Tunnel, near milepost 5 on Park Road. Click the link for a map.

title: Monday, April 8, 2024 (Solar Eclipse)
description: The last tour of the Home of Franklin D. Roosevelt will be 2:00PM. For more information on the Eclipse visit our Facebook page.
Park Full Name: Home of Franklin D. Roosevelt National Historic Site

title: Monday, April 8, 2024 (Solar Eclipse)
description: The last tour of the Mansion will be 2:00 PM For more information visit our Facebook page.

title: Hiker Shuttle will not operate March 29, April 14, & April 18-21
description: Due to staffing issues and special events, the shuttle will not operate March 29, April 14, and April 18-21.

title: High Visitation: limited EV charging, busy parking lots
description: Expect congestion in popular areas such as visitor centers and points of interest due to Spring Break. There is EXTREMELY limited EV charging in the park; consider charging in nearby Beatty, NV or other locations before arrival. Please drive with caution.

title: Trail Closure
description: Wilderness road is closed from Tennessee Road Trail to the trail up to Gap Cave for scheduled maintenance work.

title: Natural Bridges is going cashless
description: This spring, the park will start accepting only mobile or electronic payments for entrance & camping fees. People will be able to buy entrance passes and reserve campsites on Recreation.gov, or use debit/credit cards to pay entrance fees in person.

title: Hovenweep is going cashless
description: This spring, the park will start accepting only mobile or electronic payments for entrance & camping fees. People will be able to buy entrance passes and reserve campsites on Recreation.gov, or use debit/credit cards to pay entrance fees in person.

title: Western Gulls Nesting on Anacapa Island From April Through Mid-August
description: During this time, visitors will encounter seabird rookery conditions: feces, strong odor, constant noise, bird carcasses, and birds protecting their territory. If visitors consider these conditions adverse, it is advised that they visit another island.

title: Post Headquarters Temporarily Closed
description: The Post Headquarters and artillery shed are temporarily closed as contractors replace the Fire Suppression System. Follow the link below for a virtual tour of the building.

title: Quartermaster's Storehouse Temporarily Closed
description: The Quartermaster's Storehouse is temporarily closed as contractors replace the Fire Suppression System. Follow the link below for a virtual tour of the building.

title: Post Hospital/Visitor Center Temporarily Closed
description: The Post Hospital and bookstore are temporarily closed. The park's information desk, with the passport cancelation station and Jr. Ranger books, will be on the first floor of the West Infantry Barracks next door. Work is almost complete on this building.

title: Hiking in Gold Mine Tract
description: Visitors are restricted to the designated trails within the Gold Mine Tract in the Great Falls area. This location is generally defined as that area bordered by MacArthur Boulevard and Berma Road and depicted on the Great Falls Maryland Hiking Map.
Park Full Name: Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park

title: Sandy Hook Season Beach Passes available April 16 on recreation.gov.
description: Sandy Hook Season Beach Passes will go on sale April 16 at 10 am through Recreation.gov

title: No Water at Rough Canyon
description: The water at Rough Canyon is not operational, so there are no fish cleaning station, potable water, or restroom. There are portable outhouses. Bring drinking or cooking water when visiting / camping in the area; 1 gallon per person per day is recommended.

title: Buxton Beach Access & Adjacent Beach Temporarily Closed
description: The Buxton Beach Access, located at the end of Old Lighthouse Road in Buxton, and an adjacent three-tenths of a mile long stretch of beach, are temporarily closed due to petroleum contamination and remnant military infrastructure.

title: Prescribed Fire
description: March 27-April 5: Part of the Big Sandy Creek Unit will be closed while firefighters conduct a prescribed fire. Smoke may be visible in nearby communities. Trails in other units will remain open. Click/tap "More" for a map of the closure.

title: Towpath Trail Frazee - Station Road Bridge
description: Canal sinkhole near mile marker 15. Closed until further notice for public safety. Canal pump shut down so maintenance can assess and repair the sinkhole. Water is flowing from the canal through the towpath to the river.

title: Closure of Campsites in Park Campgrounds
description: Due to infrastructure improvements this summer, Turkey Run Group Campground is closed 10-1-23 thru 4-30-24, Cabin Camp 3 is closed until 4-30-24, and Campsite A1-A24, A31-A42, and B1-B7 in Oak Ridge Campground will be closed from 12-12-23 thru 4-25-24.

title: Prince William Forest RV Campground will be closed until the end of April 2024
description: Due to delay in infrastructure improvements, the concession operated RV campground off of Hwy 234 will now be closed until April 30, 2024.

title: Manzanar Visitor Center Hours
description: The visitor center at Manzanar National Historic Site is open four days a week, Friday through Monday, 9AM to 4:30PM. The visitor center will be closed Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. Block 14 and the grounds remain open daily.

title: Towpath Delays
description: Visitors can expect delays on the towpath in the Great Falls, MD area of the towpath due to tree work scheduled to begin on March 28th and last through April 7th.
Park Full Name: Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park

title: Single-Lane Road Closure for Road Work at Milepost 117.4
description: There is an emergency repair of a pipeline crossing the Parkway at mp 117.4. The project will start Monday 3/25/24. It will involve the temporary closure of the southbound lane from 9am-4pm daily for at least 2-3 days.
relatedRoadEvents: [{'title': 'Single-Lane Road Closure for Road Work at Milepost 117.4', 'id': 'DB8555D8-72FB-4174-9AF1-B5A3BBACC1D3', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/natr/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]

title: Trail Condition Updates
description: Park hiking trails currently have a range of conditions varying from deep snow to mud and ice. Water-resistant hiking boots, traction devices, trekking poles and dressing in layers is highly recommended. Snow levels are deep enough for snowshoeing.

title: Interior Restrooms Closed at the Visitor Center during Renovation: Drinking fountains open
description: Toilets are available in the parking lot at the Visitor Center while the interior restrooms are undergoing renovation. The drinking fountain/bottle filling station is on. Work is scheduled to be complete by early April.

title: Phone number for contacting Morristown NHP
description: Until phone issues are resolved, please call the Jockey Hollow Visitor Center at 973 543 4030 when seeking park information or attempting to contact park staff at the Washington's Headquarters Museum.

title: Maurice Stephens Parking Lot Closed During Construction Project
description: The parking lot near the Maurice Stephens house, located on Rt 23 opposite from the Washington Memorial Chapel, is closed during construction and renovation work on the house. Visitors are encouraged to park in the Chapel lot for Grand Parade trail access

title: Help Prevent Aquatic Invasive Species (AIS) Infestation
description: A number of lakes are infested with an array of aquatic invasive species that damage natural ecosystems and waterways. Boaters are advised to Clean, Drain, and Dry all boats and equipment every time they leave the water. Click "more" to learn about AIS.

title: Gulf Coast canoe/kayak launch and visitor center close on April 1 for construction
description: Alternate launch sites for backcountry access include the Rod & Gun Club, Outdoor Resorts of Chokoloskee, and Chokoloskee Island Park and Marina. Fees at these sites vary. Call the Gulf Coast Contact Station at 239-232-0057 for more information.

title: Henry Hill Tour Canceled, 4/6
description: Due to events in the park and staffing availability, the Henry Hill tour will be canceled on 4/6 at 11 a.m. In lieu of the tour, the Brawner Farm will be open from 8:30 until 1:30 p.m. and you are welcome to visit during that window.

title: Temporary Schedule Change - Open Wednesday Through Sunday
description: As of March 25th, we are temporarily moving to a Wednesday through Sunday schedule while we bring on new staff during this Spring season. We plan to be back to a full 7-day per week schedule by May 5th. We apologize for any inconvenience.
Park Name: Rosie the Riveter WWII Home Front
Park Full Name: Rosie the Riveter/World War II Home Front National Historical Park

title: Hiker Shuttle Service Suspended April 18 & 19
description: Due to a special event, the 9 am hiker shuttle will not operate Thursday, April 18 and Friday, April 19. Additional shuttles will be provided Saturday, April 20.

title: Faraway Ranch Parking Lot Closed April 17-19
description: Due to a special event, only vehicles with disability plates or placards will be allowed to park at Faraway Ranch from 3 pm on Wednesday, April 17 to 6 pm on Friday, April 19.

title: No Oversized Vehicles, Stock, or Horses April 17-20
description: Due to a special event, no vehicles beyond 24 feet, trailers, horses or stock use are allowed in the park from 3 pm on Wednesday, April 17 to 6 pm on Saturday, April 20. Exception: Vehicles with reservations at the campground may proceed directly to site.

title: Transition to Summer Schedule
description: The Andrew Johnson NHS will transition to summer hours on Sunday, April 7th, 2024. At this time the park will resume a 7-day a week operation from 9:00 am - 4:00 pm daily.

title: Service Road Closure
description: The Service Road/Trail from the Lighthouse parking lot toward the lighthouse and the road between the fort and visitor center hills are closed to due scheduled construction of the roadway. Please do not enter the area.

title: Fire Ban in Effect
description: San Juan Island National Historical Park is placed under a fire ban.
Park Full Name: San Juan Island National Historical Park

title: Closure of Paul H. Douglas Center for Environmental Education
description: Due to the construction of a new bridge over Lake St., the Douglas Center will be temporarily closed on weekdays approximately 3-4 weeks, and intermittently through July 2024. A smaller portion of the parking lot and trails are still open every day.

title: Spruce Railroad Trail Closure
description: A temporary steel plate has been installed at the Daley-Rankin Tunnel and pedestrian bridge on the Spruce Railroad Trail and the trail is fully open. Once a permanent steel plate is delivered, the trail will close for 1-2 days for installation.

title: Trail Construction around Visitor Center
description: There are trail closures in effect around the Visitor Center. This is the first phase of a major trail rehabilitation project in the park. Please call (336) 288-1776 for more information.

title: Construction Closures And Traffic Delays Expected on Generals Highway in April and May
description: There will be construction occurring between Hospital Rock and Giant Forest Museum in April and May. The work will require periodic closures or traffic delays. The construction schedule will be finalized soon. For more information, click the "more" link:

title: Garbage Disposal at Point Reyes is Unavailable Until Further Notice.
description: The park's garbage truck is undergoing maintenance and park staff are unable to collect refuse from the park's garbage cans and dumpsters until further notice. Please help protect wildlife and keep your park beautiful by packing home all trash.

title: Weekend Guided Tours Availability
description: Please visit the Guided Tours of the Taft Family Home page to review the tour times available for visitors on weekend day visits.
Park Full Name: William Howard Taft National Historic Site

title: No Visitor Center
description: Currently, there is no visitor center for Amache National Historic Site. There is a museum in the town of Granada that is operated by Amache Preservation Society. Learn more at amache.org

title: Winter Seasonal Road Closures
description: Portions of the Teton Park Road (Taggart Lake TH to Signal Mt.), Moose-Wilson Road (Granite Canyon TH to Death Canyon Road), and other roads are closed to vehicles. Check the Grand Teton Roads page for the latest seasonal and weather related closures.

title: New Tour Times
description: Contact the Visitor Center at 505-757-7241 to confirm tour and ranger-led program availability.

title: Spring Schedule
description: Park Rangers are available 9:00AM-4:30PM Wednesday-Friday. Guided walking tours at 2PM. Park ranger availability and 2PM tours are provided on weekends as staffing permits. Please call 973-523-0370 the day of your visit to ensure availability.
Park Full Name: Paterson Great Falls National Historical Park

title: Shiloh Visitor Center Closure
description: UPDATE - The Shiloh visitor center museum remains closed for exhibit installation. The Shiloh film is being shown in the visitor center auditorium. Please enter through marked side door facing parking area.

title: Steel Creek Ranger Station Open - Limited Hours
description: The Steel Creek Ranger Station is open for limited hours from Fri-Sun. If you arrive and the building is closed, please call or visit the Tyler Bend Visitor Center for Park information.

title: Most Park Roads Closed to All Vehicles
description: Spring plowing has begun and most roads are closed to all vehicles until mid-April. The road between the North and Northeast entrances remains open and is open year-round to regular vehicles.

title: Backcountry and Trail Closures Due to Flood Damage
description: The following areas & trails are closed: Guadalupe Ridge (visitor center to Slaughter Canyon Trail), Rattlesnake Canyon, & Juniper Ridge. Click "More" for information about trails that are open.

title: Closures on parts of Garden Key and Loggerhead Key
description: Until further notice, all finger piers and slips, and the dinghy beach between the finger piers and the South Coaling Dock are closed on Garden Key. On Loggerhead Key, the Historic Preservation/Adaptive Use zone around the lighthouse is closed.

title: The Dragoon Barracks are Temporarily Closed
description: The Dragoon Barracks are temporarily closed as the park repairs damages from a major leak in the fire suppression system. Follow the link below for a virtual tour of the building.

title: Park Buildings Temporarily Closed on Wednesdays & Thursdays
description: This closure only effects park buildings and programing, the grounds are still open daily from 1/2 hour before sunrise until 1/2 hour after sunset. To visit the site virtually, follow the link at the bottom.

title: U.S. Highway 50 Roadwork (On hold until Spring 2024)
description: Road construction with delays and nightly closures on US Highway 50 between Cimarron and Pine Creek continues at least through Summer 2024. The road is open to two-way traffic on weekends and holidays. Cycling is not permitted through the project.

title: Boardwalks at Carrington House and Watch Hill Closed
description: Due to recent storm damage, boardwalks at the Carrington House and Watch Hill Nature Trail are closed until further notice.

title: Park contact stations (visitor centers and ranger stations) closed in winter October thru April.
description: The national park and preserve public lands are open year-round, with limited access in winter. Visitor centers are open in summer but closed for winter. Call (907) 822-7250 or email wrst_info@nps.gov for park information.

title: Summer 2024 visitor contact station days and hours of operation.
description: HQ Visitor Center 5/13-9/15 daily 9-5; Slana Ranger Station 5/24-9/21 daily 9-5; Chitina Ranger Station 5/24-8/31 Fridays and Saturdays only 9-5; Kennecott Visitor Center 5/24-9/6 daily - hours vary. Call 907-822-7250 for more information.

title: Visitor Center Work in Progress
description: The park's visitor center is getting some much need upgrades to its heating, venting, and air conditioning system. The work is expected to last into early 2024. The work may intermittently prohibit use of the visitor center's theater.
Park Full Name: San Antonio Missions National Historical Park

title: Operations Schedule
description: Effective December 3, 2023, the park grounds and restrooms will be open daily from 9:00 am - 5:00 pm. The Visitor Center will be open Wednesday through Sunday from 10:00 am - 4:00 pm.

title: Infrastructure Projects in 2024 may impede access
description: Due to major infrastructure projects occurring in the park this year, intermittent traffic disruptions, campground closures, and parking impacts will be visible through the busy season. Call 775-234-7331 for most current information.

title: Annual Temporary Closure of Presidio Trust Managed Trails for Coyote Breeding Season
description: To reduce the potential for coyote/dog conflict, Presidio Trust has proactively closed large sections of the Park Trail and the Bay Area Ridge Trail to dog walking. Trails will reopen to dog walking in fall after pupping season ends. See link for more.

title: Delta-01 Tours Modified
description: Due to mechanical issues and repairs, Delta-01 tours will be modified and only include the topside and will not go underground to the Launch Control Center. Instead, there will be a virtual tour of the underground.

title: No Drinking Water at Dante Fascell Visitor Center
description: Beginning on March 13, 2024 for approximately two weeks drinking water will be unavailable at the Dante Fascell Visitor Center during a construction project. During this time visitors are asked to bring as much water as they will need for their visit.

title: Winter Hiking Safety
description: During the winter, if you plan to hike the trails at Florissant Fossil Beds it is recommended to be prepared with proper footwear, traction devices, and trekking poles. Some areas of the trails can be snow-packed and/or icy and slippery.

title: South Parking Lot construction starting Monday, March 18
description: Construction on the South Parking Lot is scheduled to begin on Monday, March 18, 2024. Construction is expected to last roughly 3 weeks weather permitting. There will be intermittent closures, so please follow all signs and instructions.

title: Horse Trail Closed
description: The Horse Trail remains closed due to excessively wet ground conditions. A decision on the timeframe for reopening the trail will be made in the spring of 2024.

title: BOARDWALK CLOSED along the River Trail
description: Due to structural issues, the boardwalk along the river trail is closed until further notice. Access to the Ocmulgee Heritage Trail and river is not available due to this closure. This closure does not affect access to any of the mound sites.

title: High Levels of Visitation Warning
description: Due to spring break expect high levels of visitation from the months of March through May. Expect limited parking, long lines, and crowded areas. Please have your form of payment ready or park pass with ID when checking in.

title: Montezuma Castle and Montezuma Well Closed To RV's/Trailers
description: Due to high levels of visitation expected and limited parking; from 10am-2pm parking for oversized vehicles will not be permitted. This means RV's, trailers, buses, or any vehicle that takes up more than one parking space. Drop off at flagpole is allowed.

title: Be Aware of Your Surroundings
description: Ongoing investigation of an aggravated assault between Nolands Ferry and Point of Rocks parking areas. Let others know your itinerary, walk with a buddy, and be aware of your surroundings. Submit a tip: 888-653-0009, nps_isb@nps.gov, go.nps.gov/SubmitATip
Park Full Name: Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park

title: Inaccurate Third-Party Apps
description: Some third-party hiking apps are providing inaccurate trail and safety information to users. Please use the official NPS app for accurate information.

title: Cave Tours Suspended Beginning May 1, 2024, Through Fall for Elevator Replacement
description: Due to a complete replacement and modernization of our elevator system, tours of Wind Cave will be closed beginning May 1, 2024, and continuing through the fall.

title: East and West Auto Tour Closed
description: Due to recent weather events the East Auto Tour has been temporarily closed. The West Auto Tour is closed for the season.

title: Solar Eclipse on April 8, 2024
description: What visitors need to know to view the eclipse from Lyndon B. Johnson National Historical Park.
Park Full Name: Lyndon B. Johnson National Historical Park

title: Rim Drive and North Entrance Road are CLOSED for the Season
description: The roads will not reopen until sometime in June or July as plow operators are gradually able to clear sections of large quantities of snow. All other roads remain OPEN, *weather permitting.* Expect snowy and icy conditions. All Oregon chain laws apply.

title: Summer Operating Hours
description: Beginning Sunday March 10th, the park will begin operating on the summer hours of 6:00 AM - 8:00 PM.

title: Green Tree Tavern Closed
description: The Green Tree Tavern building and grounds are currently closed for a roofing project.

title: Park grounds hours change Sunday 10 March
description: Beginning March 10, park grounds will be open 8 am to 7 pm. The Western Avenue entrance gate to Jockey Hollow will close at approximately 6:30 pm.

title: Credit/Debit Card only for park entrance fees
description: Starting May 1, 2023, Prince William Forest Park will no longer accept cash for park entrance fees. Entrance fees and passes can be purchased with credit/debit card at the park or online through recreation.gov.

title: Henry Hill Restrooms
description: Effective February 22, 2024, the restrooms inside the Henry Hill Visitor Center are only open during building hours (9:30 am-5:00pm). We apologize for any inconvenience.

title: Harbor Seal Pupping Season Closures are in effect from March 1 through June 30.
description: From March 1 through June 30, the park implements closures of Drakes Estero, Double Point, & the western end of Limantour Spit to protect harbor seals during the pupping season. Please avoid disturbing seals to ensure a successful pupping season.

title: The Island Loop Drive on Jamestown Island closed to vehicular traffic beginning Monday, March 18
description: The Island Loop Drive on Jamestown Island at Colonial National Historical Park will be closed fully to vehicular traffic beginning Monday, March 18 to protect turtles during periods of increased activity and conduct a turtle activity study.

title: Seasonal closure of certain areas to prevent poaching
description: The floodplain forest between the Connecticut River and NH Route 12A, north of the Blow-Me-Down Brook and forested areas on either side of Saint-Gaudens Road are closed to prevent damage from fiddlehead poaching during the months of April and May.

title: The Island Loop Drive on Jamestown Island closed to vehicular traffic beginning Monday, March 18
description: The Island Loop Drive on Jamestown Island at Colonial National Historical Park will be closed fully to vehicular traffic beginning Monday, March 18 to protect turtles during periods of increased activity and conduct a turtle activity study.

title: Ivanpah Road Repairs - Traffic Subject to minor delays
description: Mojave National Preserve Road Crews will be repairing a problematic low water crossing ~2 miles north of the Junction of Cedar Canyon Road. Minor Delays are expected.

title: Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway beginning August 14, 2023, to cause closures.
description: Beginning Monday, August 14, 2023, construction will close the Colonial Parkway from Ballard Street in Yorktown to Fusiliers Road, which will remain open. The Route 17 access ramps will be closed. This segment may remain closed through Winter 2024/2025.

title: Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway beginning August 14, 2023, to cause closures.
description: Beginning Monday, August 14, 2023, construction will close the Colonial Parkway from the Williamsburg Tunnel southward to the Route 199 interchange. The North England Street access ramp will remain open to local traffic through Summer 2024 (estimate).

title: English Camp Visitor Center closed.
description: The English Camp Visitor Center is closed for the season. It will reopen in May.
Park Full Name: San Juan Island National Historical Park

title: Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway beginning August 14, 2023, to cause closures.
description: Beginning Monday, August 14, 2023, construction will close the Colonial Parkway from the Williamsburg Tunnel southward to the Route 199 interchange. The North England Street access ramp will remain open to local traffic through Summer 2024 (estimate).

title: Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway begins August 14, 2023, will cause closures
description: Beginning Monday, August 14, 2023, construction will close the Colonial Parkway from the Williamsburg Tunnel southward to the Route 199 interchange. The North England Street access ramp will remain open to local traffic through Summer 2024 (estimate).

title: Evening Closures in May
description: The main entrance of the park as well as Bannister Bridge Canoe Launch will close at 4:30 PM daily May 16-25. All visitors will need to exit before 4:30 PM. Campgrounds will be closed during this time, and no backcountry camping permits will be issued.

title: Firefly Viewing Event & Lottery
description: The 2024 Firefly Viewing Event and lottery dates have been announced. Please read park news release for more details.

title: Very limited parking at China Beach (through early 2024)
description: A majority of the parking lot will be closed as a multi-phase project kicks off. Access to the beach will remain open. The first phase is expect to complete early 2024. See link for more.

title: Kelso Depot Main Restrooms Closed - No Water Available - Temporary Restrooms May be Available.
description: The main restrooms at Kelso Depot are closed. Temporary restrooms may be available in the depot parking lot. Additional restroom facilities: Kelso Dunes, Baker, and Primm, NV. No water available at Kelso - Water available at Hole in the Wall area.

title: Main Park Roads Open to Vehicular Traffic Starting March 10
description: Beginning Sunday, March 10th, 2024, main park roads will be open to vehicular traffic from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.

title: Ocean Beach Fire Season in Effect through October 31, 2024
description: Fires allowed ONLY in provided fire rings between Stairwells 15 and 20. For more information, check the link below.

title: Traffic & Parking Alert: Monday, April 8, 2024
description: Traffic on the day of Monday, 4/8 is expected to be heavier than normal. Handicapped parking will be available for free on the N. James St. corridor. All others should plan on taking advantage of free city street parking in the blocks surrounding the

title: Historic Fort Hours
description: Please note that as spring hours are phased in, the historic fort will be closed until Tuesday, April 16, 2024. The park visitor center will be open Tuesday thru Saturday during this time frame.

title: Generators Permitted in Loop C Only
description: Generators are only permitted in Loop C of the Fruita Campground. Generator use hours limits are still in effect.

title: 2024 Permits Now on Sale Through Recreation.Gov
description: Fishing Access, FBF Archery, GKP Boat Ramp permits available for purchase ONLINE ONLY through RECREATION.GOV from March 1- April 30 ONLY.

title: High Levels of Visitation
description: Due to spring break expect high levels of visitation through the months of March through May. Expect limited parking, long lines, and have your pass or form of payment ready when checking in.

title: Pilgrim Heights Parking Area and Access Closed 3/11-4/20
description: Between 3/11-4/20, the Pilgrim Heights parking area and access roadways in Truro will be temporarily closed to allow for repaving and survey work. 24-hour vehicle and pedestrian closures will be in place during this time.

title: Winter High Water Warning - Lifejackets Mandatory
description: The Delaware River is measuring above 8 feet at the Montague Gauge. Lifejackets are mandatory for boaters from November 1st until April 30th due to risk of cold-water shock. River accesses will be closed if the river reaches 15 feet or hazards arise.
Park Full Name: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area

title: River Ferry at Akers (on State Highway K) CLOSED until further notice
description: The Akers Ferry on State Highway K will not be in service until further notice.

title: Kīlauea volcano is not erupting
description: The eruption that began on September 10, 2023 has ended. No lava fountains, flows, or night glow is visible at this time.

title: Condition of Turkey Creek Trail
description: Turkey Creek Trail, located near the Harbor Bay Campground Area, is currently underwater in some parts. We are working on this issue. An alternative hiking trail would be Harbor Bay Trail.

title: Road Construction Closures
description: Blue West and Fritch Fortress are closed to the visiting public due to road construction. There is no public access.

title: A reservation is required to drive into or through Yosemite on some dates and times April 13–Oct. 27
description: A reservation is required from 5 am to 4 pm on some dates from April 13 through October 27, 2024. April 13–June 30: weekends and holidays only. July 1–August 16: Daily. August 17– October 27: weekends and holidays only.

title: Prepare for Crowds and Heavy Traffic
description: March and April are our two busiest months. Expect limited parking, full campgrounds, and long lines at entrances. Parking lots and trailheads may temporarily close due to traffic congestion. For our best trip-planning advice, click the link below.

title: Winter Weather - Road Conditions
